The central question on that frontier today is what to do with the welfare system, which in the American political vocabulary refers to programs geared to aid the poor: medical assistance (Medicaid), monthly payments to offset family expenses under Aid for Dependent Children (AFDC), and public housing. A challenge has arisen from many different voices that the remedies have not always reduced the scope of the problem—and indeed have sometimes increased it. These critiques often have in common only an agreement that the present system has failed its promise. They run from the center—the moderate camps of the major parties, which advocate gradual reform under the banner of “welfare to work”—to more thoroughgoing critiques of the dependency fostered by the system and more sweeping views of solutions based on self-reliance.

辩论的焦点集中在联邦层面的福利改革立法上。1996年8月最终通过的法案的核心内容是废除“家庭援助计划”（AFDC），这是传统福利方案的核心组成部分。取而代之的是“贫困家庭临时援助”（TANF），这不仅仅是表面上的改变。它限制了援助的期限，并要求受助者登记求职，接受任何能找到的工作。目前，这种做法正在一些关键问题上接受检验，例如……体面的工作。但联邦福利改革最持久的影响或许并不在于此，而在于将这一问题从联邦层面全面下放至州层面。各州将获得整笔拨款，用于自行选择的任何福利改革方式。各州州长和州议会正在竞相制定改革方案，力求成为其他州效仿的典范。

The debate has focused on welfare-reform legislation at the federal level. The act finally passed in August 1996 has as its centerpiece the revocation of AFDC, a core component of the classic welfare package. Its replacement, Temporary Assistance to Needy Families (TANF), means more than just a cosmetic change. It limits the duration of support and requires recipients to enroll in job searches and take whatever jobs they can find. That approach is now being tested on such critical matters as the supply of decent jobs. But the most enduring aspect of federal welfare reform may turn out to lie elsewhere. It is in the wholesale devolution of the issue from the federal to the state level. States are to receive block grants to apply to welfare reform in whatever way they choose. The race is on among governors and state legislatures to devise reforms that will become the model for other states to follow.

在国家层面，政府福利角色中最紧迫的问题或许在于其对老年人的责任。预计在六到十年内——比如到2005年——社会保障的资金基础将面临巨大压力，甚至可能导致崩溃。为此，有人讨论将部分社会保障信托基金投资于股市，或者将其完全私有化，用个人管理的退休账户取代信托基金。但问题可能远不止于此，因为令人担忧的趋势不仅仅是金融方面的，更根本的是人口结构方面的。老年人口占总人口比例的快速增长意味着——在目前的现收现付制下——更少的劳动者需要赡养更多的老年人。

At the national level, the most urgent question about the welfare role of government may well be its responsibility to the elderly. Within six to ten years—by, say, 2005—the funding base of Social Security is expected to be under enormous pressure, leading to the possibility of a bust. In response, there is discussion about investing part of the Social Security trust fund in the stock market or privatizing it altogether by replacing the trust fund with individually managed retirement accounts. But the problem may run deeper than this, for the trends that cause alarm are not simply financial but, more fundamentally, demographic. The rapid growth of the elderly as a share of population means—with the present pay-as-you-go system—fewer workers supporting more older people.

“与国家同龄”

“As Old as the Country”

美国政府与市场关系的重新定义源于一个非常基本的趋势——人们对政府本身日益增长的犬儒主义和怀疑态度。“对政府的不信任是美国政治文化的一部分，而且一直如此，”政治分析家威廉·施耐德指出，“这种不信任与美国历史一样悠久。那么，为什么政府的规模会如此庞大？答案是实用主义。每当危机来临，人们都会指望政府解决问题。”罗斯福新政和第二次世界大战增强了人们对政府的信心。约翰·肯尼迪以公共服务的理想主义激励了一代人，而这种精神如今已难以想象。然而，在20世纪60年代中期，犬儒主义开始成为一股强大的潮流，越南战争和国内动荡加剧了这一趋势。水门事件和20世纪70年代的经济困境进一步助长了这种趋势。罗纳德·里根的“美国早晨”时期曾出现短暂的平静，但此后犬儒主义仍在持续增长。其结果是降低了公众对政府及其能力的期望。

The redefinition in the relationship between government and marketplace in the United States is being driven by a very basic trend—growing cynicism and skepticism about government itself. “Distrust of government is part of American political culture and always has been,” observed political analyst William Schneider. “This distrust is as old as the country. Then why has government gotten so big? The answer is pragmatism. Whenever there is a crisis, people have looked to the government to solve it.” The New Deal and World War II built confidence in government. In a way that is hard to recall now, John Kennedy inspired a generation with idealism about public service. In the mid-1960s, however, cynicism began to emerge as a powerful trend, stoked by the Vietnam War and domestic turbulence. Watergate and the economic travails of the 1970s fueled it further. There was a respite during Ronald Reagan’s “morning in America,” but cynicism has continued to grow since then. The result is lowered expectations for government and for what it can do.

克林顿政府的历程生动地展现了这种变化的程度。比尔·克林顿于1993年以新民主党人的身份就任总统，尽管他的政府开局便推出了一份长达1300页的全国医疗保健计划，推行了产业政策，并奉行“战略贸易”。然而，仅仅几年后，克林顿就宣布大政府时代终结，签署了一项规模庞大的福利改革法案，并将自由市场作为冷战结束后美国外交政策的根本目标。但这种变化是相对的。当共和党控制的国会极力试图取消一项庞大的援助计划时，情况就截然不同了。研究发现，公众并不打算放弃社会保障体系，也不打算放弃对教育和环境的承诺。从克林顿医改方案的失败到金里奇革命的失败，美国政坛涌现出一个新的中间派。其特点是：政府在许多领域的扩张势头停止，一些领域甚至出现权力下放；围绕政府在社会价值观领域的扩张问题，各方持续争论不休；以及力求使市场机制适应政府活动。此外，它还包含一种共识，即强调财政廉洁这一在不久前还显得相当老派甚至古怪的美德。17

The extent of the change is dramatized by the journey of the Clinton administration. Bill Clinton came into office in 1993 as a New Democrat, though his administration began with a thirteen-hundred-page national health care plan, introduced industrial policies, and pursued “strategic trade.” Within a few years, however, Clinton was proclaiming the end of the era of big government, signing a massive welfare reform bill, and promoting free markets as a fundamental objective of American foreign policy after the end of the cold war. But such changes are relative. When a Republican Congress fervently sought to roll back a vast agenda of aid programs, it found that the public was not about to give up its social safety net or its commitment to education and the environment. Between the failure of the Clinton health care plan and the rejection of the Gingrich revolution, a new middle has emerged in American politics. It is characterized by an end to the growth of government in many spheres, some rolling back, some devolution, a continuing battle over government’s expansion in the realm of social values, and a drive to adapt the mechanisms of the market to the activities of government. It also includes a consensus emphasizing what not so long ago seemed the quite old-fashioned, even quaint, virtue of fiscal rectitude.17

1几年后，早已战败并一度经营旅店的麦戈文将自己生意的失败归咎于政府过度监管。

1Some years later, McGovern, long defeated and for a time an innkeeper, would blame the failure of his business on excessive government regulation.

2然而，沃尔克本人却受到了打击，因为德国总理赫尔穆特·施密特曾鼓励沃尔克和其他美国官员勇敢地与通货膨胀作斗争，但后来施密特却严厉批评了沃尔克所嘲讽的“自基督诞生以来最高的实际利率”。

2Volcker was, however, personally stung when German chancellor Helmut Schmidt, who had bolstered the courage of Volcker and other American officials to take up the battle against inflation, later bitterly criticized what he derided as “the highest real interest rates since the birth of Christ.”

第十三章

CHAPTER 13

即使以压倒性优势来看，这场胜利也堪称压倒性——在议会中赢得了179个席位的多数优势。1997年5月1日，托尼·布莱尔领导的工党取得的胜利，超过了克莱门特·艾德礼领导的工党在1945年二战胜利之际击败温斯顿·丘吉尔的那场胜利。这不仅是工党历史上最大的胜利，而且要追溯到1832年，才能找到保守党遭遇如此惨败的一次选举。

EVEN AS LANDSLIDES GO, it was overwhelming—a 179-seat majority in Parliament. The victory of Tony Blair’s Labour Party on May 1, 1997, exceeded the one by which Clement Attlee’s Labour Party had routed Winston Churchill in 1945, at the very moment of triumph in World War II. Not only was it the biggest victory in the history of the Labour Party, but one would have to go all the way back to 1832 to find an election in which the Conservative Party had been so thoroughly trounced.

艾德礼政府开创了混合经济和福利国家模式。这是工党应对大萧条、二战以及战后重建需求的方案。反过来，英国的“战后安排”也成为世界各地国家与市场关系的典范，在这一模式中，国家扮演着主导角色。这标志着对旧秩序的彻底否定。

The Attlee government had invented the mixed economy and the welfare-state. They were Labour’s answer to the Great Depression, World War II, and needs of reconstruction. In turn, Britain’s “postwar settlement” became the model for the relationship of state and marketplace around the world, one in which the state was to play the guiding role. It was a decisive repudiation of the old order.

托尼·布莱尔的胜利也意味着对过去的否定，尽管并非对撒切尔革命的否定。保守党的确惨败，而且败得很惨，但这并非否定其基本理念，而是否定其执政表现。十八年来，保守党已变得疲惫不堪、四分五裂，其信誉和正直也因层出不穷的丑闻而备受侵蚀。然而，在漫长的竞选过程中，布莱尔和新工党对自身历史的批判力度丝毫不亚于对保守党的批判。新工党摒弃了旧工党及其对干预主义和国家扩张的执着。而到了最终胜选之时，新工党实际上已经接受了撒切尔主义，尽管这是一种经过“同情”和“包容”等元素深度改造的撒切尔主义。工党在经历了近二十年的低谷后重返执政，这并非玛格丽特·撒切尔的失败，而是她革命成果的巩固。

Tony Blair’s victory also amounted to a repudiation of the past, though not of the Thatcherite revolution. The Conservatives were certainly defeated, decisively so, but this was a rejection of their performance, not their basic ideas. Theirs was a party that over eighteen years had become tired and divided, its credibility and integrity eroded by incessant scandals. Yet in the long run-up to the election, Blair and New Labour had campaigned as vigorously against their own past as they had against the Conservatives. New Labour rejected Old Labour, with its commitment to intervention and the expansive state. And by the time of its victory, New Labour had embraced Thatcherism, although a remake of Thatcherism heavily leavened with “compassion” and “inclusiveness.” The return of the Labour Party to power after almost two bleak decades in the wilderness represented not a defeat for Margaret Thatcher but a consolidation of her revolution.

从艾德礼到布莱尔，这半个世纪的历程，勾勒出经济运动的变迁：从一个国家试图攫取并控制经济命脉的时代，过渡到如今自由市场、竞争、私有化和放松管制等理念主导世界经济思想的时代。在战后几十年里，艾德礼政府的理念成为世界各国政府的行动指南。同样，在20世纪90年代，撒切尔夫人政策的理念也影响了全球市场经济的新格局。布莱尔的政策是否预示着第三次经济革命——左翼政党向市场和更加开放的全球经济靠拢？

The half-century arc from Attlee to Blair captures the story of the movement from an era in which the state sought to seize and control the commanding heights of the economy to an era in which the ideas of free markets, competition, privatization, and deregulation are capturing the commanding heights of world economic thinking. In the postwar decades, the ideas associated with the Attlee government became the rulebook for governments around the world. Similarly, in the 1990s, the ideas that characterized Margaret Thatcher’s policies have influenced a new market focus worldwide. Will the Blair policies point to a third revolution—the accommodation of left-wing parties to the market and to a more open global economy?

工党内部的变革最终促成了布莱尔的胜选，而这种变革源于失败，源于一系列惨痛的选举失利。直到1983年，工党还发表了一份宣言——曾被形容为史上最长的“自杀宣言”——其中仍然呼吁推行所有经济干预的手段：大规模国有化和再国有化、政府中央计划、外汇管制、贸易壁垒。在1983年败选后的十年里，工党领导层——在尼尔·金诺克及其继任者约翰·史密斯的领导下——努力实现党的现代化。但他们希望谨慎行事，以避免分裂。他们称自己的策略为“长远之计”。正如史密斯所解释的：“我不认为你应该急于求成，把所有东西都摆在橱窗里，等到下周三再拿出来。”然而，1994年，史密斯在伦敦一家医院的急诊室突发心脏病去世。讽刺的是，就在几周前，他还在为保住这家急诊室而奔走呼吁，以应对预算削减。

The changes in the Labour Party that propelled Blair to victory arose from failure, a series of bitter electoral defeats. As late as 1983, the Labour Party had produced a manifesto—once described as the longest suicide note in history—that still called for all the paraphernalia of economic intervention: massive nationalization and renationalization, government central planning, exchange controls, trade barriers. In the decade after the 1983 defeat, Labour’s leadership—under Neil Kinnock and then his successor, John Smith—struggled to modernize the party. But they wanted to do it cautiously, in order to avoid a split. They called their strategy “the long game.” As Smith explained it, “I don’t believe that you should rush forward and put everything in your shop window for the next Wednesday.” But then, in 1994, Smith collapsed of a heart attack and died in a London hospital emergency room. Ironically, only weeks earlier he had campaigned to keep the same emergency room open in the face of budget cuts.

他的继任者是安东尼·布莱尔，这是他年轻时作为一名崭露头角的律师时的名字；但在1983年赢得议会席位后，尽管工党整体惨败，他更为人熟知的名字是托尼·布莱尔。在议会的最初几年，布莱尔并没有偏离工党的正统路线；他主张“大规模的国家指导和干预”。但后来，他逐渐认为工党的传统方案与现实脱节，于是开始重新定义政治挑战，使其适应市场。不到三年时间，他就对这个左翼最受尊敬的政党之一进行了意义非凡且彻底的改造。

His successor was Anthony Blair, as he had been known when he was an up-and-coming young barrister; but he was known better as Tony Blair after he won a seat in Parliament in 1983, despite the overall Labour debacle. In his first years in Parliament, Blair did not stray much from Labour orthodoxy; he advocated “enormous state guidance and intervention.” But then, coming to believe that Labour’s traditional prescriptions were out of sync with reality, he started to redefine the political challenges in terms of accommodating to the market. In less than three years, he would implement a remarkable and thoroughgoing remodeling of one of the most venerable parties of the left.

布莱尔比党内许多其他人更乐于接受变革，因为他并没有被保守党的历史所束缚。事实上，他的父亲曾是达勒姆当地保守党协会的主席，也是保守党议会候选人，却不幸突发严重中风。当时布莱尔只有十岁。他的父亲是一位以律师和演说家为生的人，却在三年内无法说话。布莱尔曾回忆说，他“每分每秒”都待在达勒姆医院，要么探望正在康复的父亲，要么照顾重病缠身的妹妹。

Blair was more open to change than many others in the party because he was not so deeply rooted in its past. His father, in fact, had been chairman of the local Conservative Party association in Durham, and had been a prospective Tory parliamentary candidate when he was felled by a massive stroke. Blair was ten at the time. For three years, his father, who made his living as a barrister and orator, was unable to speak. Blair once recalled that he spent “every spare minute” at Durham hospital, seeing either his father, who was recovering from his stroke, or his sister, who was seriously ill.

在牛津大学，与那些雄心勃勃的传统本科生不同，布莱尔专注于摇滚乐，而非政治。当其他人在牛津辩论社发表演讲时，他却在一个名为“丑陋乐队”（The Ugly）的乐队担任主唱。谣言四起。他也成为了一名虔诚的基督徒，这反过来又使他信奉他后来称之为“伦理社会主义”的理念——这种社会主义更多地植根于基督教、社群和责任，而非马克思主义、阶级斗争和对国家的依赖。在他离开牛津不久后，母亲突然去世，一位室友注意到布莱尔晚上常常坐在床上读圣经。传统社会主义的浪漫情怀对他来说并没有多大吸引力。另一方面，撒切尔夫人对他而言并不像对其他工党政客那样是敌人。毕竟，他还有父亲。“我理解父亲的想法，因为他完全是白手起家，”布莱尔曾说过，“他热衷于撒切尔革命。”1

At Oxford, unlike the conventional ambitious undergraduates, Blair focused on rock music, not politics. While others were declaiming in the Oxford Union, he was performing as lead singer for a group called the Ugly Rumours. He also became a committed Christian, which, in turn, led him to an adherence to what he later called “ethical socialism,” a socialism much more rooted in Christianity, community, and responsibility than in Marxism, the class struggle, and dependence on the state. When his mother died suddenly just after he left Oxford, a roommate observed that Blair sat up at night in bed, reading the Bible. The romance of traditional socialism did not do very much for him. And on the other side, Thatcher was not quite the enemy to him that she was to other Labour politicians. After all, there was his father. “I understood where my father was coming from because he was totally self-made,” Blair once said. “He was keen on the Thatcher Revolution.”1

“很简单”

“It’s Simple”

布莱尔不愿长期处于反对党地位。到了20世纪80年代末，他与时任财政大臣戈登·布朗合作，成为工党内最积极的改革者之一。当被问及工党为何长期在野时，他的回答总是千篇一律：“很简单，世界变了，而工党却没变。”他决心改变现状。他试图让工党与工会保持距离（他向工会承诺的是“公平而非偏袒”），支持削弱工会权力（这在左翼看来是不可饶恕的，但却是赢得民众信任的关键），并积极争取撒切尔夫人私有化政策催生的新股东。他对老工党的批判也越来越像撒切尔夫人。“我们不会重蹈20世纪70年代的覆辙，”他在大选前说道。他坚持认为，工党不应该被贴上“增加税收、维持高通胀经济、效率低下……而且，顺便说一句……让工会掌控一切”的标签。保守党在1979年的观点是正确的：“集体权力过大、官僚机构过多、国家干预过多，围绕这些权力又滋生了太多利益集团……社团主义国家干预的时代已经结束了。”私下里，布莱尔甚至表示他赞同撒切尔夫人的做法。布莱尔的市场化改革激怒了传统左派，他们戏称他为“托尼·布莱尔”（Tony Blur）。

Blair had no taste for remaining permanently in opposition. By the end of the 1980s, working with Gordon Brown—now the chancellor of the Exchequer—Blair emerged as one of the party’s most aggressive modernizers. Asked why Labour had been out of power for a generation, he always replied in the same way: “It’s simple. The world changed, and the Labour Party did not.” He was determined to change it. He sought to distance the Labour Party from the trade unions (“fairness not favors” was what he offered them), supported reductions in union power (anathema to the left, but essential to capture the trust of the country), and courted the new shareholders created by the Thatcher privatizations. His critique of Old Labour began to sound more and more like Thatcher’s. “We’re not reliving the 1970s,” he said before the election. The Labour Party should not be known, he insisted, as a party that “bungs up your taxes, runs a high-inflation economy, and is hopelessly inefficient… and, by the way… let the trade unions run the show.” The Tories were right in 1979 that “there was too much collective power, too much bureaucracy, too much state intervention, and too many interests created around it… . The era of corporatist state intervention is over.” In private, Blair would go further, saying that he agreed with what Thatcher had done. Blair’s march to the market infuriated the traditional left, which took to calling him Tony Blur.

他以最彻底的方式否定了老工党的正统观念，迫使该党放弃了其意识形态支柱——1918年由西德尼·韦伯起草的党章第四条。该条款呼吁实行国有化，即“生产资料、分配和交换的公有制”。这是一场激烈的斗争，几乎摧毁了整个工党。但布莱尔绝不容忍任何倒退。当一位工党政客主张将电力公司重新国有化时，布莱尔粗暴地斥责他“成熟点”。

In the clearest rejection of Old Labour orthodoxy, he forced the party to renounce its ideological backbone, Clause IV of its constitution, drafted in 1918 by Sidney Webb, which called for nationalization in the form of “the common ownership of the means of production, distribution, and exchange.” It was a furious battle, which threatened to destroy the party. But Blair would not tolerate any backsliding. When a Labour politician advocated renationalization of electric utilities, Blair brusquely told him to “grow up.”

在1997年大选前的这段时间里，布莱尔前往了资本主义的圣地——这是工党历史上首次造访资本主义阵营。他向华尔街发表讲话，随后又在伦敦金融城向金融界发表演讲，彻底否定了混合经济模式。他表示，任何政府的目标都应该是降低税收，而不是提高税收。“我们应该假定经济活动最好由私营部门主导，”他说。该党历史上首次发布了面向企业的竞选宣言。

In the period leading up to the 1997 election, Blair made his way to the sacred precincts of capitalism—paying the first-ever visit by a Labour Party leader to Wall Street, and later giving an address to the financial community of the City of London, where he buried the mixed economy. He said that the objective of any government should be to lower, rather than raise, taxes. “The presumption should be that economic activity is best left to the private sector,” he said. For the first time in its history, the party issued an electoral manifesto for business.

布莱尔就任首相后，他的主张更加激进。他声称，英国应该成为一个“企业家之国”。然而，“国家现代化”远不如工党现代化那样清晰明了。尽管如此，布莱尔所称的“激进中间路线”或“第三条道路”的基本理念已经成型：传统的凯恩斯主义经济干预和管理方式行不通，经济也无法免受全球竞争的影响。相反，政府的职责是让经济更好地运转，促进机会平等和更大程度的公平，以及“包容性”。实现这一目标需要“长期主义”，即投资于教育和其他人力资本创造领域。福利国家需要保留，但要精简并进行改革。个人将拥有更多权利，但也承担更多责任。

Once ensconced as prime minister, Blair went farther. Britain, he said, should become a “nation of entrepreneurs.” But “modernizing the nation” is proving a much less clear project than modernizing the Labour Party. Yet the basic concepts for what Blair variously called the “radical middle” or “third way” are in place: Traditional Keynesian intervention and management of the economy cannot work. Nor can the economy be sheltered from global competition. Rather, government’s role is to make the economy work better—and to promote opportunity and greater equality, along with “inclusiveness.” This it is to do through “long-termism”—investment in education and other generators of human capital. The welfare state is to be preserved, but slimmed down and reformed. The individual is to have more rights, but also more responsibilities.

大选后不久，布莱尔就明确表明了他重塑政治的决心。他邀请了玛格丽特·撒切尔到唐宁街10号喝茶聊天，这无疑激怒了老左派。毕竟，在他们眼里，撒切尔就是魔鬼的化身。但这并没有真正困扰布莱尔。他打算坚持自己的竞选纲领。2

Not long after the election, Blair made clear how far he was committed to redefining politics. He invited none other than Margaret Thatcher to come to 10 Downing Street for tea and a chat, which could only enrage the old left. After all, she was the devil incarnate. That did not really bother Blair. He intended to stay on message.2

新的共识？

The New Consensus?

当玛格丽特·撒切尔发起改革时，以市场为中心的理念曾被视为激进且不合时宜，但在不到二十年的时间里，它已成为新的共识。政府仍然被赋予保障社会福祉的根本责任；但在工业化国家，如今的争论焦点在于如何界定这一责任，其范围应该有多广或多窄，以及如何提供服务——简而言之，是如何改革这一体系。

The market focus that had seemed radical and beyond the pale when Margaret Thatcher initiated her revolution has become the new consensus in less than two decades. Governments continue to be entrusted with a fundamental responsibility for welfare; but in the industrial world, the debate is now about how to define that responsibility, how broad or limited it should be, and how to deliver services—in short, how to reform the system.

但究竟发生了多少改变？这种新的共识究竟根深蒂固？布莱尔当选不到一个月，以利昂内尔·若斯潘为首的法国社会党就重返执政，给法国右翼带来了毁灭性的打击。但他们的言论听起来并不像新社会党。他们提出的计划让人想起上世纪80年代初失败的重组政策。由于失业率居高不下（是英国的两倍），他们的议程很大程度上受制于现实，承诺扩大公共部门就业、提高劳动报酬并放缓私有化进程。执政后，政府很快在经济政策上采取了更为务实的立场。但这一事件表明，仅仅建立在经济紧缩基础上的欧洲一体化理念面临着多么严峻的挑战。布莱尔和若斯潘在瑞典举行的一次社会主义大会上会面，更凸显了这种差异。在他们取得胜利之后，布莱尔告诉与会代表，左派的任务是“将开放、竞争和成功的经济与公正、体面和人道的社会结合起来”。他发出警告：“要么现代化，要么灭亡。”若斯潘毫不掩饰他的反对意见：“市场力量，”他说，“如果不加以控制，将会威胁到我们对文明的根本认知。”他接着抨击了他所谓的“极端资本主义”。

But how much has really changed? How deeply rooted is this new consensus? Less than a month after Blair’s election, the French Socialists, led by Lionel Jospin, sailed back into government, delivering a devastating defeat to the French right. But they did not sound like New Socialists. They presented plans that recalled the ill-fated relance policies of the early 1980s. With their agenda largely set by the reality of unemployment—twice the level of that in Britain—they promised to expand public-sector employment, increase labor charges, and slow privatization. Once in power, the government soon took a far more pragmatic stance in its economic policies. But the episode showed just how deep was the challenge to an idea of European unity that seemed founded on economic austerity alone. The difference was made clear when Blair and Jospin met at a socialist congress in Sweden just after their victories. The task of the left, Blair told the delegates, was “marrying together an open, competitive and successful economy with a just, decent and humane society.” He served notice that “we modernize or die.” Jospin made no secret of his disagreement: “Market forces,” he said, “if there is no attempt to control them—will threaten our very idea of civilization.” He went on to attack what he called “ultracapitalism.”

事实上，无论世界经济如何变革，人们对市场根深蒂固的不信任感始终存在。为什么？乔治·舒尔茨指出其中一个原因，他说：“市场是无情的。”随着竞争日益激烈，人们无法摆脱市场的压力。人们转而寻求政府的庇护，以应对市场持续不断的需求。转向市场经济或许能带来更高的生活水平、更好的服务和更多的选择，但同时也带来了新的不安全感——对失业的担忧、对工作稳定性和工作场所压力的担忧、对失去应对人生变迁的保障的担忧、对环境的担忧、对社会保障体系瓦解的担忧、对医疗保健以及老年生活保障的担忧。无论是白领还是蓝领工人，都担心（有时也确实发现），雇主为了取悦金融分析师，会打破社会契约，削减那些为公司奉献了十五到二十年宝贵青春的员工的工资、福利，甚至解雇他们。此外，市场的全球化特性颠覆了传统价值观和熟悉的组织形式，加剧了人们的失控感，并引发了对过去及其既定秩序的怀念。尽管有所收获，但也存在损失，而千禧一代的焦虑情绪更凸显了这些损失。人们内心充满矛盾，处于一种不安的平衡状态。正如克林顿政府一位高级官员谈到“我内心的自由市场主义者和自由主义者之间的斗争”时所言。在一些国家，人们坚信私有化进程意味着政府资产落入了政府盟友手中，从而使他们暴富。即使是精心策划的私有化项目，其结果也意味着社会内部财富、权力和地位的重新分配，而所有这些都可能令人感到不安。

Indeed, whatever the transformations in the world economy, an underlyingmistrust of the market persists. Why? George Shultz pointed to one reason when he said, “Markets are relentless.” As competition becomes more intense, there is no respite from its pressures. People turn to government to provide shelter from the constant demands of the market. The move to the market may bring a higher standard of living, better services, and more choice. But it also brings new insecurities—about unemployment, about the durability of jobs and the stress of the workplace, about the loss of protection from the vicissitudes of life, about the environment, about the unraveling of the safety net, about health care and what happens in old age. Workers—both white- and blue-collar—fear, and sometimes find, that employers, in order to please financial analysts, will break the social contract and cut salaries, benefits, and jobs of employees who have given fifteen or twenty irretrievable years of their life to the company. Further, the global nature of the marketplace disrupts traditional values and familiar forms of organization, amplifying the sense of a loss of control and generating a nostalgia for the past and its settled order. While there are gains, there are also losses, all of which are given a special edge by the undercurrent of millennial anxiety. There is an ambivalence and an uneasy balance. It is heard when a senior official in the Clinton administration talks about the battle between “the free marketeer in me and the liberal in me.” It is encountered in the conviction in some countries that the process of privatization has meant the movement of government assets into the hands of those who are friends of the government, massively enriching them in the process. Even with an expertly executed privatization program, the results mean a redistribution of wealth, power, and status within a society, all of which can be highly unsettling.

尽管存在疑虑和不满，但向市场经济的转型是由信心平衡的转变所驱动的——人们对政府能力的信心下降，但对市场运作机制的重新认识抵消了这种下降。我们的父母和祖父母曾深受大萧条的创伤，可能一直生活在对另一次经济衰退的恐惧之中。在美国，历史上对市场的怀疑和批评主要集中在串谋倾向（进步主义者的批评）和市场失灵的风险（罗斯福新政的关注点）。然而，自二战以来的半个世纪里，市场体系展现出了非凡的活力，极大地提升了其信誉。我们必须停下来思考这种观念转变的程度。1975年，经济学家阿瑟·奥肯——总统经济顾问委员会主席——当然，一个经历过大萧条的人会说：“市场需要一个场所，而且市场必须待在它该待的地方……如果给它机会，它会扫除所有其他价值观，建立一个自动售货机社会。我对此最多只能表示两声喝彩。” 此后的二十年里，美国的实际GDP几乎翻了一番；而这种论调，以及其背后隐藏的不信任，听起来已经过时了。1997年经济顾问委员会的年度报告更凸显了这种对比，该报告的主题是“市场的优势”。事实上，委员会关注的是它所谓的“市场被低估的特性”——“市场收集和传播信息的能力”——这正是典型的哈耶克式观点。该报告批评罗斯福新政将对政府“全知全能”的信念“固化”为一种“新型自由主义”。所有这些都是一种截然不同的世界观。3

Yet despite the doubts and the discontents, the move to the market is being driven by a shift in the balance of confidence—a declining faith in the competence of government, offset by a renewed appreciation of the workings of the market. One’s parents and grandparents, so deeply traumatized by the Great Depression, may have lived with the permanent fear of another slump. In the United States, suspicion and criticism of the market historically focused on the tendency toward collusion—the Progressives’ critique—and the risk of market failure—the New Deal’s preoccupation. Yet over the half century since World War II, market systems have demonstrated extraordinary vitality, enormously enhancing their credibility. One has to pause to grasp the extent of the shift in outlook. In 1975, the economist Arthur Okun—a chairman of the President’s Council of Economic Advisers and, of course, a child of the Great Depression—would say, “The market needs a place, and the market needs to be kept in its place… . Given the chance, it would sweep away all other values, and establish a vending-machine society. I could not give it more than two cheers.” In the two decades since, real GDP in the United States has almost doubled; and that tone, and the mistrust that underlies it, sounds archaic. The contrast is made all the more stark by examining the 1997 annual report of the Council of Economic Advisers, the main theme of which is the “advantage of markets.” Indeed, the Council’s focus on what it called the “insufficiently appreciated property of markets”—“their ability to collect and distribute information”—is vintage Hayek. And the report criticized the New Deal for having “crystallized” the belief in “the omniscience and the omnipotence” of the government “into a new kind of liberalism.” All this is a very different view of the world.3

编织的世界

The Woven World

如今，在经历了世界大战、革命和经济大萧条的冲击之后，全球经济正在复苏——重新连接。正如蒸汽机和电报缩小了十九世纪世界的版图一样，如今的科技再次消弭了距离和国界。但这一次的影响更为广泛，几乎没有哪个国家或社区能够置身事外。诸多指标都印证了这一趋势。国际航空旅客人数从1970年的7500万增至1996年的4.09亿。1976年至1996年间，从美国到英国三分钟电话的实际费用从约8美元降至最低36美分——跨境电话通话量也从1985年的32亿次增至1996年的202亿次。如今，世界各地的人们共享着来自电影和娱乐的相同画面；同样的新闻和信息从卫星传回地球，瞬间形成描述事件的通用词汇。

Today, there is a resumption—a relinking—of a global economy after the disruptions of world wars, revolutions, and depression. As the steam engine and the telegraph shrank the dimensions of the nineteenth-century world, so technology today is once again eroding distance and borders. But this time the effects are much more comprehensive, for they leave virtually no country or community untouched. The pattern is evident in a host of measures. The number of international air passengers rose from 75 million in 1970 to 409 million in 1996. Between 1976 and 1996, the cost of a three-minute phone call from the United States to England dropped in real terms from about eight dollars to as low as thirty-six cents—and the number of transborder calls has increased from 3.2 billion in 1985 to 20.2 billion in 1996. Today, the world shares the same images from film and entertainment; the same news and information bounces down from satellites, instantaneously creating a common vocabulary for events.

在这一切之中，决定性的新力量是计算机：信息技术正在创造一个由遥远相遇和即时连接交织而成的世界。知识和信息无需等待。在组织内部、外部以及跨越国界，人们紧密相连，分享信息和观点，在虚拟团队中工作，以物易物，交换债券和货币，闲聊琐事，消磨时光。各种信息唾手可得。随着美国政府数据网站的建立，一个十岁的孩子就能获取比五年前一位高级官员所能获取的更多、更优质的数据。图书馆在互联网上开放。研究人员实时分享他们的研究成果。活动人士联合起来宣传他们的事业。潜在的恐怖分子上网寻找武器设计图。所有这一切都越来越无视民族国家，也越来越游离于传统的组织结构之外。如果说互联网是新的制高点，那么它也是……超出国家控制范围。政府可以推广互联网，但无法控制它。

Amid all this, the decisive new force is computers: Information technology-is creating a woven world of distant encounters and instant connections. Knowledge and information do not have to wait. Within, outside, and across organizations and national boundaries, people are tied together, sharing information and points of view, working in virtual teams, bartering goods and services, swapping bonds and currencies, exchanging chatter and banalities, and passing the time. Information of every kind is available. With the establishment of the U.S. government data Web site in 1997, a ten-year-old could gain access to more and better data than a senior official could have done just five years earlier. Libraries are open for business on the Internet. Researchers share their results in real time. Activists band together to promote their causes. Would-be terrorists surf for weapon designs. All this is increasingly heedless of the nation-state and outside the traditional structure of organizations. If the Internet is the new commanding heights, it is also beyond the reach of the state. While governments can promote the Internet, they cannot control it.

这种新型全球化的标志是移动经济。资本以迅雷不及掩耳之势在各国间流动；制造业和服务业在各国间灵活转移，并跨越国界联网；市场供应来源不断变化。思想、洞见和技术在各国间传播的便捷程度日益提高。跨国技术获取渠道持续增长。作为国家权力行使基础的国界，随着市场一体化的推进，其界限日渐模糊。1989年至1997年间，国际贸易年均增长率达5.3%，几乎是全球产出增长率（1.4%）的四倍。同期，外国直接投资的增长速度更快，年均增长率高达11.5%。变革速度之快的一个标志是，越来越多的企业转型为跨国公司，向世界市场提供在多个国家构思、生产和组装的商品和服务。“原产地”标准已被“本地化”所取代，而“本地化”的定义也变得越来越难以界定。快速、可靠的信息和通信技术的普及促使企业利用世界各地的人才和资源。

The hallmark of this new globality is the mobile economy. Capital sweeps across countries at electron speed; manufacturing and the generation of services move flexibly among countries and are networked across borders; markets are supplied from a continually shifting set of sources. Ideas, insights, techniques all disperse among countries with increasing ease. Access to technology across national boundaries continues to grow. Borders—fundamental to the exercise of national power—are eroded as markets are integrated. International trade between 1989 and 1997 grew at an annual rate of 5.3 percent—nearly four times faster than global output (1.4 percent). Over the same years, foreign direct investment rose even faster—at a rate of 11.5 percent per year. One indicator of the rapidity of change is the transformation of more and more firms into multinationals that provide the world market with goods and services that are conceived, produced, and assembled in several countries. The criterion of “national origin” has given way to “local content,” which in turn is becoming harder and harder to pin down. The spread of fast, reliable information and communications technology pushes companies to draw on people and resources the world over.

随着壁垒的降低，私人资本开始在曾经由国家投资垄断的领域——能源、通信和基础设施——寻求新的市场。而各国政府为了减少赤字、将支出转向社会需求，也越来越欢迎这类投资。另一个令人想起一百年前的例子是，私营企业在电信、水务、电力和道路建设等领域的新投资份额以及管理责任都在不断增加，这在全球范围内都是一个例证。如今，大多数国家都拥有一家或多家移动电话运营商。越来越多的国家拥有私营电力供应商。即使是那些仍然占据主导地位的大型国有垄断企业，在发达国家和发展中国家竞相争取重大合同时，也开始像私营公司一样运作——它们的管理者也像商人一样行事。

As the barriers fall, private capital seeks new markets in what had once been the special preserve of state investment: energy, communications, and infrastructure. And governments, anxious to reduce deficits and shift spending to social needs, increasingly welcome this investment. In another telling reminder of a hundred years ago, private firms are taking on an increasing share of new investment, as well as responsibility for management, in telecommunications, waterworks, power utilities, and road construction worldwide. Most countries today have one or several mobile phone operators. A growing number have private electric power providers. Even the remaining large state monopolies are behaving like private companies—and their managers as businessmen—as they compete for major contracts beyond their own national borders in both developed and developing countries.

金融市场的一体化意义尤为重大。信息和通信技术固然为全球互联的资本市场提供了架构，但这仅仅是部分原因。20世纪80年代中期英国的大规模私有化是首批真正意义上的全球股权发行，它们改变了全球投资经理的思路，拓宽了他们的视野。不久之后，欧洲公司也开始发行股票。如今，全球投资者越来越多地采用相同的方法和标准进行决策，并关注同一批公司。各国市场之间的差异已然消失。在不久的将来，一些国家证券交易所很可能发展成为全球性交易所，从日出不久便开始交易，一直持续到深夜——一切井然有序。交易世界一流公司的股权，不限公司注册地。同时，龙头企业的股票将24小时不间断交易。

The integration of financial markets is particularly significant. Information-and communications technology has, of course, provided the architecture for globally connected capital markets, but that is only part of the explanation. The big British privatizations in the mid-1980s were the first true global offerings of equity, and they changed the orientation and widened the ken of investment managers throughout the world. Not long after, European companies began to offer their shares. Increasingly, investors around the globe are using the same approach and criteria to make their decisions, and they are looking at the same pool of companies. The distinctions among national markets have become lost. In not so many years, a few national stock exchanges could well become global exchanges, opening for business not long after the sun rises and not closing until well after dark—all in order to deal in the equity of world-class companies, irrespective of their domicile. In turn, shares of leading firms will be traded on a twenty-four-hour basis.

上世纪60年代，哈罗德·威尔逊担任英国首相时，他将英镑的持续疲软归咎于“苏黎世的侏儒们”，暗示少数几个冷酷无情的瑞士银行家组成了一个阴谋集团，暗中做空英镑。阴谋论根深蒂固：1997年东南亚货币危机爆发时，针对国际经济“流氓”和“强盗”的指控再次甚嚣尘上。但事实上，如今成千上万的交易员推动着外汇市场的发展，其日交易额已从1986年的1900亿美元增长到1997年的约1.3万亿美元。分析师、经纪人和策略师在同一时间看到相同的信息，并竞相做出反应。任何市场表现——无论是公司的季度收益、国家的通货膨胀率、贸易收支数据，还是全国大选的结果——都会立即引发连锁反应。公众每隔几年才投票一次，而市场每分钟都在投票。曾经被称为第三世界的国家正在积极争取和吸引私人资本——即发达国家的养老金和积累的退休储蓄。但这种金融一体化是有代价的。无论是发达国家还是发展中国家，各国政府都必须越来越重视市场的投票——尽管有时市场投票的结果可能非常残酷。4

When Harold Wilson was Britain’s prime minister in the 1960s, he would blame the “gnomes of Zurich” for the pound’s recurrent weakness, suggesting a cabal of a few hard-faced Swiss bankers cynically betting against the British currency. Conspiracy theories die hard: no less colorful allegations—against the “rogues” and “highwaymen” of the international economy—surfaced with the 1997 currency crisis in Southeast Asia. But, in fact, today thousands and thousands of traders drive a foreign-exchange market that has grown from a daily turnover of $190 billion in 1986 to an estimated $1.3 trillion in 1997. Analysts and brokers and strategists see the same information at the same moment and compete in their response time. Performance—whether it is a company’s quarterly earnings or a country’s inflation or trade balance data or the outcome of a national election—sets off an immediate chain reaction. While the publics vote only every few years, the markets vote every minute. And it is private capital—the pensions and accumulated retirement savings of the first world—that is being courted and lured by what used to be called the third world. But this financial integration comes with a price. National governments, whether in developed or developing countries, must increasingly heed the market’s vote—as harsh as it sometimes can be.4

美国财政部长罗伯特·鲁宾指出：“开放的资本市场创造了巨大的机遇和利益，但也带来了风险。世界贸易正在增长，但货币交易的增长速度更快。由于这些市场规模庞大，资金流动频繁，因此更容易引发不稳定。如果资金全部流向同一方向，其规模之大足以破坏市场稳定，其影响也可能十分巨大。”

“Open capital markets create tremendous opportunity and benefits,” observed U.S. Secretary of the Treasury Robert Rubin. “But they create risks as well. World trade is growing, but trading in currency is growing at a much steeper rate. There is a greater risk of these markets causing instability because they are so large, and so much money is moving around in them. If it all moves in one direction, the size of the flows can be destabilizing, and the impact could be substantial.”

移动经济中的公司

The Company in the Mobile Economy

全球市场格局的演变也改变了企业的处境。前景既充满吸引力又暗藏威胁——机遇更加广阔，竞争也更加激烈。各种界限正在瓦解。国家间的政治、经济和意识形态边界持续消融，促进了投资和贸易的流动。曾经保护企业免受竞争冲击的监管体系和国家垄断正在发生改变。随着通信技术和计算机技术的进步（以及成本的下降）和思想的自由流动，信息和知识流动的限制正在逐渐消失。计算机、联盟和外包使得企业的壁垒变得更加难以逾越。事实上，要确定……一家公司结束的地方，就是另一家公司开始的地方。随着运营变得更加透明，并受到外部投资者更加严格的审查和要求，财务壁垒也在逐渐瓦解。所有这些都带来了更广泛、更多样化的机遇。但这同时也意味着更激烈的竞争和更大的风险，以及来自资本市场和拥有更多选择的客户所带来的持续压力。

The emergence of the market focus around the world changes the position of companies as well. The prospect is both attractive and threatening—wider opportunities and tougher competition. Boundaries of every sort are coming down. Political, economic, and ideological borders among nations continue to erode, promoting the flow of investment and trade. Regulatory systems and national monopolies that provided protection against competition are being altered. Restrictions on the movement of information and knowledge are disappearing in the face of advances in communications technology and computers (and declining costs thereof) and in the freer flow of ideas. The very walls of the company are being made more permeable by computers, alliances, and outsourcing. Indeed, it is becoming more difficult to ascertain where one company ends and another begins. The financial walls are coming down, too, as operations become more transparent and subject to much more aggressive scrutiny and demands by outside investors. All this adds up to a much wider and more diverse range of opportunity. It also means more bracing competition and more risk, along with the relentless pressure generated by capital markets and by customers who have a broader range of choice.

因此，企业被迫转变思维方式。它们必须做好准备，迎接未来日益严峻的压力。这意味着要培育一种鼓励警觉、响应和灵活的企业文化，并加快流程和决策的周期。在“重组”和结构调整之后，竞争压力要求企业重新认识员工及其所掌握的知识。强调知识的重要性，充分利用知识，并迅速将其整合到整个组织中——这些都成为企业在市场中增强竞争力的途径。信息技术正在推动这一进程；因此，企业的组织方式正在经历巨大的变革。层级分明的金字塔式企业结构正在被扁平化的低层组织所取代——减少官僚主义，加强团队合作，并更加分散责任、信息和决策权。

Thus, companies are being forced to think differently. They have to prepare themselves for a world in which these pressures are only going to become more intense. That means fostering a culture that encourages alertness, responsiveness, and flexibility, and speeding up the cycle time of processes and decisions. In the aftermath of “reengineering” and restructuring, competitive forces now demand a rediscovery of employees and of the knowledge they command. Emphasizing the importance of knowledge, harnessing it, and speedily integrating it across the organization—these become the ways to strengthen the firm in the marketplace. Information technology is driving the process; and as a result, the way that companies are organized is undergoing a massive change. The high-rise pyramids of hierarchical corporate structures are being transformed into the low-rise of the flatter organization—less bureaucracy, more teamwork, and greater dispersion of responsibility, information, and decision making.

企业究竟还会发生多大的变化？英国石油公司是大型企业中较为先进的一家，它正在重塑自身组织架构以适应计算机时代。然而，其首席执行官约翰·布朗认为，信息技术对商业的影响仍处于早期阶段：“技术进步是不可逆转的。政治潮流可能会来来去去，但我们不会抛弃新技术。它就像棘轮一样，推动着进步。这是一股规模巨大的新技术浪潮，其影响可能比电力或内燃机的发展更为深远和广泛，因此，变革的进程很可能仍在积蓄力量。”

How much more will companies change? British Petroleum is one of the more advanced large companies in reshaping its organization to fit the computer age. Yet its chief executive, John Browne, argues that the impact of information technology on business is still in its early stages: “Technological advance is not reversible. Political trends can come and go, but we do not throw away new technology. It is a ratchet of progress. This is a wave of new technology of major proportions, probably more deeply rooted and wide-ranging than the development of electricity or the internal combustion engine and, as a result, there is a real possibility that the process of change is still only gathering momentum.”

文化变革的一个显著方面体现在“企业家”这一概念上。过去，这个词往往带有负面含义，听起来不太好，让人觉得不可靠。在组织内部，如果被认定为具有企业家精神，就会被视为对既有等级制度的威胁。如今，在瞬息万变、更加开放的经济环境中，企业发现他们需要鼓励和培养重视主动性和快速反应能力的企业家价值观和态度。否则，他们将无法跟上时代的步伐。他们不需要那些自负狂妄的人，而是需要创造者和建设者。

A distinct aspect of cultural change concerns the concept of “entrepreneur.” In the past, the word often carried a negative connotation; it sounded unsavory and made someone seem unreliable. To be identified as an entrepreneurial personality within an organization was to be branded as a threat to the established hierarchy. Today, in a fast-moving and more open economy, companies are finding that they need to encourage and nurture entrepreneurial values and attitudes that emphasize initiative and rapid response. Otherwise, they cannot keep up. They hardly want swashbuckling egomaniacs. But they need creators and builders.

在政府削减自身职责的当下，企业和个人都会发现，他们对社区的责任正在扩大。无论这个社区指的是城市、地区还是更大的范围，企业都是其中的一部分，并从中受益。无论季度或半年报告的要求多么苛刻，为了提升业绩，企业会发现它们必须关注社区利益、环境问题和社会议题。否则，它们最终会受到政治进程的惩罚。

At a time when governments are slimming their responsibilities, companies as much as individuals will find that their responsibilities to the community are expanded. Whether that community is defined as a city, a region, or something larger, the corporation is part of it and benefits from it. Whatever the demands for obeisance at the altar of quarterly or half-yearly performance, companies will find that they have to engage with the community’s interests, environmental concerns, and social issues. Otherwise, they will eventually be penalized by the political process.

政府做什么

What Government Does

新全球市场的一个特征是经济似乎凌驾于政治之上。但这仅仅意味着经济凌驾于传统意识形态政治之上。如果一家公司认为边界的消弭意味着国家政治、民族认同和经济民族主义的终结，那就大错特错了。这些力量将继续表达各种愿望和抱负的融合。每个国家的政治仍然会受到其历史、文化和国家目标定义的影响——公司若忽视这一现实，必将付出惨痛的代价。这并非民族国家的终结，更不是政府的终结。尽管如今的资金和商品流通比以往任何时候都更加自由，但个人生活仍然受到规则、习俗、激励机制和限制的制约，而这些规则、习俗、激励机制和限制本质上是国家和政治性的——属于政府的范畴。个人能够接触到这个相互交织的世界，仍然仅限于世界上的少数人。绝大多数人获取信息的方式仍然不是来自全球金融市场，更不用说网络空间，而是来自国家首都。

One of the characteristics of the new global marketplace is the apparent precedence of economics over politics. But that means precedence only over traditional ideological politics. A firm would make a terrible mistake if it worked on the assumption that eroding borders meant the end of national politics, national identity, and economic nationalism. These forces will continue to express an amalgam of aspirations and ambitions. Politics within each country will still be shaped by its history, its culture, and its definition of national objectives—a reality that the firm can ignore only at its peril. This is not the end of the nation-state, and even less the end of government. If money and goods travel more freely now than at any time in living memory, individual life continues to be shaped by rules, customs, incentives, and constraints that are fundamentally national and political—the province of government. Personal access to the woven world still remains restricted to a minority of the world’s population. The vast majority still get their signals not from global financial markets, let alone Cyberspace, but from the national capital.

这给各国政府带来了一项艰巨的挑战：如何在减少某些领域干预的同时，调整和重新聚焦其他领域的干预，并维护公众的信任。这是一项想象力的挑战。它要求各国政府认同全球正在发生根本性的变化，并致力于将这种变化转化为符合本国文化、历史和民族特性的政策。

This leaves governments with a daunting challenge: to figure ways to reduce their intervention in some areas, and to retool and refocus their intervention in others, while preserving the public trust. It is a challenge of imagination. It requires buying into the idea of fundamental global change and taking on the task of translating that change into policies that accord with national culture, history, and temperament.

政府的新角色是什么？毕竟，没有政府来制定规则和界定市场环境，市场就无法存在。国家创造并维护着市场运行的各项参数。而这正是新的发展方向。国家接受市场纪律；政府不再扮演生产者、控制者和干预者的角色，无论是通过国有化还是强力监管。在竞争激烈、流动性强的经济中，国家作为管理者的作用日益落后。相反，政府将转向扮演裁判的角色，制定游戏规则，以确保竞争等各项因素的正常运作。

What will be the new role of government? After all, there is no market without government to define the rules and the context. The state creates and maintains the parameters within which the market operates. And that is the new direction. The state accepts the discipline of the market; government moves away from being producer, controller, and intervenor, whether through state ownership or heavy-handed regulation. The state as manager is an increasing laggard in the competitive, mobile economy. Instead, government shifts toward becoming a referee, setting the rules of the game to ensure, among other things, competition.

经济需要和政治利益也将迫使人们重新思考政府在构成福利国家的各项社会项目中的角色。因为政府确实花费了大量资金。在工业化国家中，公共支出占GDP的比重从1960年的28%上升到1996年的46%——这一激增主要源于补贴、转移支付和社会支出的快速增长。但政府在这些方面的表现将更加引人注目。随着政府从工业和规划的制高点退居幕后，角色转变也意味着资源及其运用方式的转变。在许多国家，通过私有化和放松管制释放出来的公共资金和人力资源将部分投入到“人力基础设施”——医疗、教育、环境等领域——人们希望，更清晰、更聚焦的角色能够带来创造力和成功。这意味着，尽管边界不断模糊，技术也发生了根本性的变革，但政府仍然至关重要——尤其重要的是，政治领导力至关重要。这也意味着，即使“更多市场”、“更少国家干预”的趋势已成为一种普遍的全球现象，它也不会导致单一的、共同的结果。5

Economic imperatives and political interests will also force a reconsideration of the government’s role in dealing with the range of social programs that make up the welfare state. For governments do spend a great deal of money. Among industrial countries, public expenditure rose from 28 percent of GDP in 1960 to 46 percent in 1996—a surge driven, most of all, by rapid growth in subsidies, transfer payments, and social spending. But government’s performance in these roles will move more clearly into the spotlight as it withdraws from the commanding heights of industry and planning. For the shift of role entails also a shift of resources and the way they are applied. The public money and human skills freed up through privatization and deregulation will be partly invested, in many countries, in “human infrastructure”—health, education, the environment—with, it is hoped, the creativity and success that can come from a clearer and better-focused role. What this means, then, is that for all the erosion of boundaries and fundamental technological change, governments still matter—and, most of all, political leadership matters. It also means that even if change in the direction of “more market” and “less state” is a pervasive global phenomenon, it does not lead to a single, common result.5

改革后的世界

The World After Reform

向市场经济转型无疑是一种真正的全球现象。它汲取了世界各地共享的理念和近期经验。变革进程——尤其是私有化、放松管制和贸易自由化——在很大程度上是共通的，经过政治倡导者和专家实践者的不断完善，最终成为一套专业的体系。随着各国在开放互联的市场体系中扎根，它们在很大程度上将控制权从传统的国家机器转移到了分散的市场智慧之上。而便捷技术的快速普及使得信息流动异常迅速，这进一步强化了这种共同发展的势头。然而，这种感觉不应被过分夸大。因为尽管存在诸多共性，每个国家和地区都在根据自身的政治经济历史和对国家利益的理解来推进其市场化转型。在如今正在形成的后改革时代，每个主要地区都面临着特定的挑战，即如何将日益复杂的全球参与要求与其自身的历史、政治、经济和文化现实相协调——所有这些都构成了个人和国家的经验和鲜活记忆。

The move to the market is beyond doubt a truly global phenomenon. It draws on a stock of ideas and recent experience shared around the world. The processes of change—particularly privatization, deregulation, and trade liberalization—are largely common ones, refined over time to a professional craft by their political champions and expert practitioners. As countries anchor themselves in a world of open and connected markets, they are to a significant degree transferring control of the commanding heights from the traditional state apparatus to the dispersed intelligence of the market. And the extraordinarily fast flow of information, made possible by the rapid diffusion of accessible technologies, has helped reinforce the sense of common momentum. Yet that feeling should not be overstated. For despite the common features, each country and region is executing its move to the market according to its own political and economic history and perception of the national interest. In the postreform world that is now emerging, each major region faces specific challenges in reconciling the increasingly complex demands of global participation with the realities of its own history, politics, economics, and culture—all the things that make up the experience and living memory of individuals and nations.

因此，改革后的世界，每个地区都将围绕各自的新世纪议程展开应对。随着国家权力从主导地位的削弱，新的视角和机遇随之而来，但成功的前提是理解区域动态。事实上，市场联系日益紧密，意味着这些区域议程将更加直接地影响世界经济的运行。改革后世界的未来，以及市场的未来健康和信誉，不仅取决于技术和全球力量，也取决于不同地区如何应对各自的挑战。

Each area, then, will grapple in this world after reform with its own agenda for the new century. As the withdrawal of the state from the commanding heights opens new perspectives and opportunities, it also conditions success on understanding the regional dynamics. Indeed, the growing connection of markets means that these regional agendas will feed back ever more directly into the workings of the world economy The future of the postreform world, and certainly the future health and credibility of markets, will thus be shaped not only by technology and global forces but also by how different regions come to grips with their particular challenges.

亚洲：旧模式与新矛盾

Asia: Old Formulas and New Tensions

亚洲大部分地区正在经历两大转型。一是政治体制的转型——摆脱威权统治。中产阶级的壮大以及服务业和软件经济的需求推动了民众更广泛的政治参与。对一些国家而言，这一转型过程充满创伤，有时甚至动荡不安。共产主义带来的严峻安全威胁不再危及国家生存，也不再将国家凝聚力置于一切之上。

Two transitions are unfolding in much of Asia. One is in the political system—away from authoritarian regimes. Greater political participation is being promoted by the growth of the middle class and the requirements of service and software economies. For some countries, the transition is proving to be traumatic and sometimes tumultuous. No longer does a dire security threat from communism put survival at risk and thus elevate national cohesion above all else.

第二次转型源于“成功”。旧有的成功模式对许多国家而言已不再奏效。1997年东南亚货币危机的直接原因是经济过热、房地产投机以及银行体系的脆弱性。然而，其背后隐藏着一个担忧：随着这些国家从低工资经济向高工资经济转型，它们的竞争力正在被削弱。它们持续高速经济增长的时代是否已经结束？或者，过去曾让它们受益匪浅的灵活性和适应性能否再次发挥作用？它们显然无法依靠廉价劳动力参与竞争，因此必须改革和重塑其经济和金融体系，并继续提升技术水平。亚洲区域经济的构建为许多国家提供了一定规模的本地市场，区域内贸易和投资或许能成为它们新的力量源泉。

The second transition is the result of “making it.” The old winning formula no longer works for many countries. The immediate causes of the 1997 currency crisis in Southeast Asia were overheating, real estate speculation, and weaknesses in banking systems. Underlying these, however, was the apprehension that countries’ competitive positions were being eroded as they move from low-wage to higher-wage economies. Is their era of consistent high economic growth over, or will the flexibility and adaptability that have served them so well in the past once again come into play? They certainly cannot compete on the basis of cheap labor, and thus they will have to reform and reshape their economic and financial systems and continue to move up the technology ladder. The forging of a regional economy in Asia provides many of them with a local market of some scale, and intraregional trade and investment may prove a source of new strength.

当然，整个地区的主导经济体仍然是日本，它仍在努力重塑自身的经济模式。这套曾运转多年且卓有成效的体系在20世纪90年代出现了严重故障。泡沫破裂，终结了20世纪80年代的投机狂潮，也暴露了其弊端。为了降低成本，恢复产业竞争力，日本正试图拆除其监管和保护的庞大体系，因为这些体系过于臃肿，难以跟上快速变化的市场步伐。与此同时，日本还面临着人口老龄化加剧的严峻现实。尽管过去几年经济形势持续低迷，但日本产业显然正在经历一场痛苦的重组，而美国企业此前已经经历过类似的重组。疲软的金融业仍然是经济复苏的主要阻力。金融业放松管制的“大爆炸”式改革旨在恢复该行业的健康。但它的影响也旨在更广泛，不仅要重振东京作为金融中心的地位，还要引入新的金融纪律，以激励日本企业提高效率和竞争力。

The dominant economy of the entire region is, of course, still Japan, which continues its struggle to redefine its own economic life. The system that worked so brilliantly for so many years badly malfunctioned in the 1990s. The weaknesses were revealed when the bubble burst, ending the speculative mania of the 1980s. In order to drive down costs and restore the competitive position of its industry, Japan is seeking to dismantle its superstructure of regulation and protection, which has proved too cumbersome to keep up with fast-paced markets. At the same time, it is confronting the demographic reality of a rapidly aging society. Despite what has become chronic gloom over the last several years, Japanese industry is clearly going through a painful restructuring of the kind that American business has already passed through. The ailing financial sector continues to be a major drag on recovery. The “big bang” of financial deregulation is supposed to restore the sector to health. But its impact is also meant to be broader, not only revitalizing Tokyo as a financial center but also bringing new financial discipline to bear to spur Japanese business to become more efficient and competitive.

中国：市场与党

China: The Market and the Party

中国和俄罗斯是两大变革实验室。它们分别在检验：经济改革先于政治改革，还是政治改革先于经济改革？是先有市场，后有选举，还是先有选举，后有市场？两者皆是如此。在这种情况下，实验规模极其庞大。具有讽刺意味的是，无论结果如何，这个实验可能永远都不需要重复进行。

The two great laboratories of change are China and Russia. They are testing, respectively, whether economic reform better precedes political reform or vice versa. Markets before elections, or elections before markets? In both cases, the scale of the experiment is enormous. The irony is that whatever the results, the experiment will probably never have to be repeated.

过去二十年间，中国已有超过两亿人摆脱贫困。世界从未见过如此迅速、如此大规模的变革。据估计，中国已成为世界第二大经济体；如果目前的趋势持续下去，未来二十年内，其经济规模将与美国匹敌。然而，中国尚未制定明确的市场经济规则；其经济运作仍然更多地依赖于“关系”（人脉），而非法律和合同。随着中共十五大和“邓小平理论”被确立为党的指导思想，中国已经抛弃了许多传统的社会主义内容。面对日益增长的财政赤字，中国采取的行动比预期更为迅速，正寻求将大部分国有企业剥离，使其在市场经济中自生自灭，所有权将分散到公众和海外投资者手中。这将付出巨大的代价——随着这些企业进行重组并寻求提高效率，大规模失业将不可避免地发生。领导层押注于经济解放后的活力将迅速创造新的就业机会，从而避免政治反弹。

Upward of 200 million people have been lifted out of poverty in China over the last two decades. The world has never seen change of that rapidity on that scale. By some estimates, China is already the second-largest economy in the world; and, if current trends continue, its economy will rival that of the United States in size before the next two decades are out. Yet China has still to lay down the explicit rules of a market system; its economy continues to operate much more by guanxi—connections—than by law and contract. With the 15th Party Congress and the enshrinement of “Deng Xiaoping Theory” as the canon of the Communist Party, China has jettisoned much of traditional socialism. Facing growing deficits, China has acted more quickly than expected and is seeking to cut loose most of its state-owned companies to sink or swim in the market economy, with ownership to be spread among the public and overseas investors. There will be a big cost—unemployment on a large scale will inevitably result as these firms restructure and seek to become more efficient. The leadership is betting that the liberated vitality of the economy will generate new jobs quickly enough to prevent a political reaction.

迄今为止，人们的关注点主要集中在经济变革上。但另一个问题也不容忽视：一个充满活力、快速发展的市场经济体系如何与一党专政的权力集中共存？“中国特色社会主义”在下一个世纪又将意味着什么？毫无疑问，领导层的代际更迭——这一过程本身比许多人预期的更为平稳和顺利——将推动政治体制的转型；年轻的领导人将更有信心应对那些曾令他们的长辈感到不安的变革。

To date, the focus has been on economic change. But another question is inescapable: How does a dynamic, rapidly growing market system continue to coexist with the centralization of one-party rule? What will “socialism with Chinese characteristics” mean in the next century? Undoubtedly, generational shift in the leadership, itself a smoother and more confident process than many had anticipated, will bolster a transition in the political system; younger leaders will more confidently countenance changes that would have alarmed their elders.

像中国这样幅员辽阔却依然贫穷的国家，将如何实现政治转型？转型期间又该如何维护国家权威和凝聚力？时间被认为是一种答案——足够的时间让民主从地方层面持续发展，足够的时间让民众收入达到其他亚洲国家（尽管规模小得多）那样的水平，从而促进民众更广泛地参与政治。无论政治结果如何，中国注定将在下个世纪成为该地区的经济和政治主导力量，当然，也将是全球经济中最重要的力量之一。

How will a political transition come about in a country as big and still as poor as China, and how will authority and cohesion be maintained during that period? Time is offered as one answer—enough time to allow democracy to continue to build up from the local level, enough time to allow incomes to reach the levels that have led to greater political participation in other, albeit much smaller, Asian countries. No matter what the political outcome, China is destined to be the dominating economic and political force in the region in the next century, and of course one of the most important in the global economy.

中国日益融入全球经济也将推动变革。香港的未来走向可能成为决定性因素。五十年维持“一国两制”并非易事，尤其当其中一个制度是亚洲四小龙中最自由开放的，而另一个不仅规模庞大，而且经济状况也远逊于前者时。香港与内地其他地区之间的新关系很可能加速整个中国的变革进程。这正是“中国改变香港，还是香港改变中国？”这一尖锐问题的核心所在。

China’s increasing integration into the global economy will also promote change. How Hong Kong works out could be a decisive factor. Fifty years is a long time to maintain “one country, two systems,” especially when one of the systems is the most freewheeling of all the Asian tigers and the other is not only vastly larger but also so much poorer. The new relationship between Hong Kong and the rest of the mainland could well accelerate the process of change throughout China. That is the core meaning of the piquant question “Will China change Hong Kong or will Hong Kong change China?”

俄罗斯：改革的深度如何？

Russia: How Deep Is Reform?

俄罗斯正步入后共产主义历史的新阶段。尽管共产主义暂时在选举中被推翻，但俄罗斯仍在努力建设和巩固市场经济，同时也在进行重建和现代化。市场经济的发展速度远超许多人的预期，但它仍然与一个缺乏方向、在中央计划和竞争之间摇摆不定、缺乏活力且转型能力不足的旧苏联经济体系并存。旧经济体系的很大一部分仍然掌握在一个软弱无力、难以履行现代政府最基本职能的国家手中。权威持续衰落，助长了犯罪和腐败，滋生了社会绝望。改革者们现在面临的重任是恢复政府的职能，使其能够扮演裁判和监管者的角色，而不是所有者和管理者。一个运转良好的市场需要这样一个国家。政府必须履行诸如支付养老金和建立有效的社会保障体系等基本职责，以支撑俄罗斯人民正在经历的巨大转型。

Russia is entering a new phase in its post-Communist history. With communism, for the time being, turned back at the polls, the nation continues to struggle to build and consolidate the market while at the same rebuilding and modernizing itself. The market economy is developing much faster than many had expected, although it continues to coexist with an old Soviet economy that is rudderless and marooned between central planning and competition, lacking in vitality and ill-equipped to make a transition. A good part of the old economy is still in the hands of a state that is weak and infirm in terms of its ability to carry out the most basic functions of a modern government. Authority continues to decay, facilitating crime and corruption and breeding social despair. Reformers are now taxed with restoring competence to a government that can act as the referee and regulator rather than owner and manager. A functioning market requires such a state. Government has to deliver on such basic things as the payment of pensions and a working social safety net to undergird the vast transition through which the Russian people are passing.

在发展市场经济所需制度方面已取得长足进步。一个例证是：苏联解体和经济陷入混乱的五年后，俄罗斯如今已确立了其作为合法新兴市场的地位。但仍有许多工作要做。作为市场经济基石的产权制度依然薄弱且模糊不清；竞争受到限制；法律、程序和规范亟待加强。若这些方面进展缓慢，且缺乏防范犯罪的措施，那么支撑经济复苏的新兴企业和小型企业将继续发展受阻。

Much progress has been made on developing the institutions required for a market economy. One indicator: A half decade after the collapse of the Soviet Union and the descent into the black hole of economic chaos, Russia is now established as a legitimate emerging market. But much remains to be done. Property rights, the fundament of a market economy, are still weak and obscure; competition, restricted; and much strengthening of laws, processes, and norms is required. Without progress here—and without protection against crime—new and small business, on which renewed economic growth depends, will remain stunted.

该体制尚未展现出获得合法性所需的公平公正。正如副总理鲍里斯·涅姆佐夫所言，俄罗斯正处于“匪帮资本主义”和“民主人民资本主义”的夹缝之中。共产主义的阴影已被“七大银行的统治”所取代。财富的集中极大地降低了围绕民主和市场价值观达成新的社会共识的可能性。政府必须证明自己不受制于新近致富的金融寡头。2000年的俄罗斯总统选举将是对其改革成效、经济复苏和民众支持度的又一次考验。这意味着政府没有太多时间来说服大多数民众，让他们相信，这些出乎意料地改变了他们生活的剧变，对他们来说是件好事。6

The system has yet to display the fairness and equity that are required for legitimacy. The country, as Deputy Prime Minister Boris Nemtsov put it, is poised between “bandit capitalism and democratic people’s capitalism.” The specter of communism has been supplanted by “the reign of the seven banks.” Concentration of wealth greatly reduces the chances for a new social consensus around the values of democracy and the market. The government has to demonstrate that it is not beholden to the newly enriched financial oligarchy. The Russian presidential election in the year 2000 will be the next test of reform in terms of its success, renewed growth, and popular support. That means there is not all that much time to persuade the majority of the population that they are better off from the tumultuous changes that have so unexpectedly transformed their lives.6

印度：印度教的变化率？

India: The Hindu Rate of Change?

在印度，尽管拥有民主政治传统，但人们对政府的信任却根深蒂固，达到了盲目崇拜的程度。这个国家实行“许可制度”，任何经济活动都必须经过许可才能进行。过去，办事需要盖章，而且每天都要在政府机关无休止地等待审批。1991年，印度开启了历史性的变革，开始逐步削弱政府的控制和所有权，并向全球经济开放。到20世纪90年代末，废除“许可证制度”的举措已获得政治光谱中大部分人士的认可。然而，在一个多元化的社会中，如何建立一套新的制度是一项极其艰巨的挑战。多元化提高了民众对政府的期望，同时也要求政府不断地争取支持、说服民众并建立联盟。印度的立场是，这些成本是值得承担的，几乎是出于道德考量——而且这种立场很可能会持续下去。但要满足民众的期望，惠及不断壮大的中产阶级之外的群体，并真正消除贫困，收益必须大幅增长。

In India, despite its tradition of democratic politics, the trust in government knowledge was embedded to the point of unquestioned faith. The country was ruled by a “Permit Raj,” under which any kind of economic initiative required a stamp and in which endlessly waiting around official offices for a government sign-off was essential to daily business. In 1991, India embarked on its historic change, beginning a process of rolling back government control and ownership and opening up the country to participation in the global economy. By the end of the 1990s, the rolling back of the Permit Raj was accepted across much of the political spectrum. But how to build a new system is an exceedingly daunting challenge in a society in which pluralism sharpens people’s expectations of government but also imposes the constant requirement to co-opt, convince, and build coalitions. The Indian stance has been that those costs are worth bearing, almost for moral reasons—and it is likely to stay that way. But the benefits must increase enormously to meet aspirations, spread beyond the growing middle class, and truly erode poverty.

随着对中央政府决策的依赖性降低，变革的关键信号往往来自基层。印度或许是一个政治狂热的国家，但如今，政治日益地方化和区域化，不再由庞大的国家政治机器驱动，而是由拥有区域议程的政党主导。当联盟和交易有利于其区域经济利益时，他们会积极促成；而当联盟和交易不利于其区域经济利益时，他们也会毫不犹豫地打破联盟和交易。印度拥有巨大的经济潜力，完全有可能成为21世纪全球经济的关键力量之一。然而，人们对改革的步伐感到失望，并担心复杂的联盟政治会阻碍改革进程。当务之急是确保印度经济学家过去所说的“印度式增长速度”不会被同样缓慢的“印度式变革速度”所取代。

With less dependence on central government knowledge, the vital signs of change come from below. India may be a country obsessed with politics; but today, politics is increasingly local and regional, no longer driven by elephantine national political machines but instead by parties with regional agendas. They are prepared to make coalitions and deals when these favor their regional economic interests, and to break them when they do not. The country has an enormous economic potential, which could well make it one of the key forces in the global economy in the twenty-first century. But there is frustration with the pace of reform, and fear that the complexities of coalition politics will retard it. The challenge is to ensure that what Indian economists used to describe as the “Hindu rate of growth” is not succeeded by an equally slow “Hindu rate of change.”

非洲：新的开始

Africa: A Fresh Start

如果印度取得成功，撒哈拉以南非洲地区将最认真地吸取其经验教训。在撒哈拉以南非洲，贫困和经济边缘化问题因其他因素而更加恶化：殖民主义遗留的不平衡问题，以及随后数十年来各国统治者对该地区忽视甚至掠夺的局面，所有这些都发生在一个由殖民时代遗留下来的人为政治边界分隔的小国大陆上。这些因素以不同的方式导致非洲在主权和民族认同问题上悬而未决，而这些问题在其他地区已被视为已解决，从而导致非洲的内战和武装种族冲突远超其他任何地区。近年来，中非地区发生的一系列创伤性且充满不确定性的变革吸引了全世界的目光，从卢旺达的种族灭绝和革命，到独裁者蒙博托·塞塞·塞科的垮台以及他所命名的扎伊尔恢复其最初的独立名称刚果。内战在许多小国以及一些大国（例如苏丹）仍然持续不断。尼日利亚凭借其国土面积、人力和自然资源，本应成为该地区的领导者，但它却多次“民主转型”失败，至今仍由军方控制。

If India succeeds, the lessons will be nowhere more carefully followed than in sub-Saharan Africa, where the problems of poverty and economic marginalization have been compounded by extra factors: the imbalanced legacy of colonialism, followed by decades of neglect—in some cases depredations—by national rulers, all of it on a continent of mostly small countries kept apart by artificial political boundaries inherited from colonial times. These forces have contributed, in different ways, to leaving unsettled in Africa questions of sovereignty and national identity that are considered settled elsewhere, leading to far more civil wars and armed ethnic conflicts than in any other region. In recent years, a series of traumatic and ambiguous changes across central Africa have grabbed the world’s attention, from the genocide and revolution in Rwanda to the fall of the dictator Mobutu Sese Seko and the restoration to the country he named Zaire of its original independent name Congo. Civil conflict persists in a number of small countries, as well as some large ones, such as Sudan. Nigeria, which by virtue of size and human and natural resources should have been the region’s leader, has aborted several “democratic transitions” and remains controlled by the military.

然而与此同时，近年来非洲大陆许多地区的经济转型如雨后春笋般涌现。越来越多的非洲中小经济体正在经历政府权力显著下放的趋势。一些国家在私有化方面走在了前列，即便其私有化的总量和价值可能不及其他国家。这并非主要得益于国际社会的推动，而是源于民众普遍存在的挫败感所催生出的新政治意愿。乌干达曾因伊迪·阿明将军的极端残暴和非理性行为而臭名昭著。如今，乌干达享有政治稳定，并保持着约8%的持续经济增长。加纳自20世纪80年代初夸梅·恩克鲁玛政权垮台以来，经济一直处于严重衰退状态。过去十年，加纳重组了经济，恢复了持续增长，并解放了政治体制。几内亚曾饱受塞古·杜尔暴政的蹂躏；如今，几内亚已重回增长轨道，并正努力重新开发其丰富的自然资源。这三个国家都曾跌入谷底，然后才摒弃旧的政治经济秩序，开始新的生活。

Yet at the same time, economic transformations have mushroomed in recent years in many parts of the continent. A growing number of Africa’s small and medium-size economies are experiencing a significant withdrawal of government from the commanding heights. A few have moved to the forefront in the scope of privatization, if not in its aggregate size and value. They are doing so thanks not so much to international prodding, but to a new political will that draws on a vast sense of popular frustration. Uganda was once notorious for the extreme brutality and irrational behavior of General Idi Amin. It now enjoys political stability and sustained output growth of around 8 percent. Ghana languished in severe economic decay from the collapse of Kwame Nkrumah’s system through the early 1980s. In the past decade, it has restructured its economy, restored sustained growth, and freed the political system. Guinea suffered under the tyrannical and arbitrary rule of Sekou Toure; it is now returned to growth, and attempting to redevelop its considerable natural resources. All three of these countries had to hit rock bottom before repudiating the old political and economic order and setting off to a fresh start.

最重要的变化发生在南非。多数党政府从种族隔离制度下继承了一个相对发达的工业和商业经济体，其发展水平远超非洲其他国家；它放弃了以往的激进主义（非洲人国民大会曾是一个马克思主义政党），转而采取稳健务实的策略，并接受以市场为基础的组织形式。南非正在成为区域增长的引擎。其企业正积极策划铁路、公路运输和电力网络的整合，并将业务拓展至遥远的北部地区。这种发展势头，以及西非和东非其他规模较小的类似举措，将经济增长从少数几个地区——如乌干达、科特迪瓦等——扩展到广袤的内陆地区。但许多国家的迹象表明，政府意识到自身发展过度，现在准备重拾对私营商业传统的信心。这种传统早在殖民时期之前就已存在，并且克服重重困难和坚决反对，一直延续至今。

The most important change is in South Africa. The majority government inherited from the apartheid order a relatively industrial and commercial-economy, by far the most developed in Africa; and it has renounced its former radicalism (the African National Congress was a Marxist party) in favor of a measured, pragmatic tone and acceptance of market-based organization. South Africa is turning into a regional motor of growth. Its firms are masterminding integration of rail and road transport and electric networks far to the north. It will take this dynamic, and others on a smaller scale in West and East Africa, to spread growth from a few pockets—Uganda, Côte d’Ivoire, and others—to a vast hinterland. But the signs from many countries are that governments realize they overstretched themselves and are now prepared to restore faith in a private commercial tradition that existed long before the colonial period and, against all odds and in the face of determined opposition, has endured ever since.

拉丁美洲：谁在参赛？

Latin America: Who Plays?

拉丁美洲的改革始终笼罩在上世纪80年代“失去的十年”的阴影之下。当时，债务危机扼杀了经济增长，人民生活水平下降。显而易见，政府的大规模所有制和控制正在抑制经济活力。由于似乎别无选择，政府规模大幅缩减。但如今，该地区各国必须实现国家现代化，使其运作方式与过去截然不同，效率更高，并提供恰当的公共服务组合。所有这一切的根本在于寻求亟需的规则，为经济领域的参与者提供清晰的信号和方向。与此同时，各国必须确保市场带来的益处惠及民众——通过更好的医疗保健、更好的教育、更好的……必须及时地为弱势群体提供机会，以确保其可信度。广大民众必须从自身的日常生活中感受到，开放——融入世界经济、吸引外资、扩大贸易和推进私有化——能够满足他们的愿望。如果人们反而认为这主要是少数人致富的工具，那么就会面临强大的政治压力，迫使政府修改或撤销这些改革。

Reform in Latin America is haunted by the “lost decade” of the 1980s, when the debt crisis stanched economic growth and standards of living fell. It became clear that massive government ownership and control were suppressing economic vitality. The result—because there no longer seemed to be a choice—was a massive retreat of government. But now countries in the region have to modernize the state and see that it works both differently and more efficiently than in the past, and that it delivers the proper mix of services. Underlying all this is the quest for the desperately needed rules of the game that will give clear signals and directions to those operating in their economies. At the same time, they must make sure that the benefits of the market flow—through better health care, better education, better opportunities—to the disenfranchised in a way that is timely enough to ensure credibility. The broad population has to be convinced, from its own daily experience, that the opening—to the world economy, foreign investment, expanded trade, and privatization—can add up to a formula that satisfies their aspirations. If people see it instead as mainly a device to enrich a minority, then there will be strong political pressure to revise or reverse the reforms.

政治改革与经济改革相伴而生；该地区几乎所有政府如今都是民选产生的。然而，近期一些国家的选举结果表明，民众对改革成果的分配并不满意，并对私有化和重组带来的失业问题感到不满。尽管变革始于智利、玻利维亚和阿根廷等相对较小的国家，但如今焦点已转移到拉丁美洲最大的两个国家。墨西哥正经历着政治体制的剧变——执政党革命制度党（PRI）的势力削弱，反对党势力增强——与此同时，其经济结构也在持续重组。2000年的总统选举将是对其全面考验。最后，整个南美洲都将受到巴西发展程度的影响。巴西不仅是世界最大的经济体之一——其GDP是俄罗斯或印度的两倍——而且拥有巨大的发展潜力。实际计划成功地将通货膨胀率从1994年的5000%降至1997年的10%以下，从而创造了更加稳定的营商环境。费尔南多·恩里克·卡多佐在1998年连任总统的可能性将有助于确保政策的延续。该国正在推进大规模私有化，这有助于刺激外国投资的激增。现在的关键问题是落实能够促进更强劲经济增长的改革。但改革面临着联邦与州权力划分以及根深蒂固的既得利益集团的阻挠等重重阻碍。

Political reform has accompanied economic reform; almost every government in the region is now democratically elected. Yet the results of recent elections in a number of countries point to dissatisfaction with the distributions of the benefits of reform and a backlash against the job loss that privatization and restructuring entail. While change started in relatively smaller countries, like Chile, Bolivia, and Argentina, the focus is now on the two largest countries of Latin America. Mexico is coping with a radical change in its political system—the weakening of the PRI and the bolstering of opposition parties—even as its economy continues to undergo restructuring. The full testing will come with the presidential election of the year 2000. Finally, all of South America will be affected by the degree to which Brazil moves ahead. It is not only one of the largest economies in the world—with a GDP twice that of Russia or India—but it has tremendous potential. The real plan succeeded in bringing inflation down from 5,000 percent in 1994 to under 10 percent in 1997, providing a much more stable business environment. The likelihood of Fernando Henrique Cardoso’s reelection as president in 1998 will help to ensure continuity. The country is moving ahead with large privatizations, which is helping to stimulate a surge of foreign investment. The critical issue now is to implement the reforms that will permit stronger economic growth. But reform faces obstacles that result from the division between federal and state authority and the opposition of deeply entrenched interests.

欧洲：欧元及其不满

Europe: The Euro and Its Discontents

开放市场带来的大规模私有化和放松管制正迫使欧洲传统的混合经济发生剧变。欧元即将启用以及单一市场的压力正在加速这一变革。然而，西欧正努力在失业率高企和福利国家结构令人担忧的重新思考中，确保欧盟这一宏伟历史工程的顺利进行。各国在经济协调方面究竟会走多远、走多快？欧洲能否按计划推进单一货币的实施？如果能够实现，为了促进这一进程，又将允许多大的灵活性？随着欧元启用日期的临近，包括德国在内的许多国家都出现了不满情绪，因此可能需要更大的灵活性。事实上，欧洲在包括货币在内的各个方面越是朝着单一市场迈进，关于文化认同、国家差异以及单一市场作用的争论就越会激烈。民族国家。的确，随着欧元成为欧洲大陆的通用货币，一种新的风险将会出现。一旦经济衰退，一些国家是否会面临脱离欧元区的压力？

The large-scale privatization and deregulation that come with open markets are forcing a dramatic transformation of Europe’s traditional mixed economy. The imminence of the euro and the pressures of the single market are accelerating the change. Yet Western Europe is seeking to secure the grand historical project of the European Union amid high unemployment and a troubling rethinking of the welfare state. How far and how fast will countries go in harmonizing their economies? Will Europe remain on the timetable for the single currency; and if it is to do so, how much flexibility will be allowed into the process in order to facilitate it? Greater suppleness will likely be required as the approaching date stimulates discontent in a number of countries, Germany included. Indeed, the more Europe moves toward a single market in all its dimensions, including currency, the more intense will be the debates over cultural identity, national differences, and the role of the nation-state. Indeed, as the euro becomes the coin of the continent, a new risk will emerge. Could some countries, in the event of an economic downturn, be under pressure to detach themselves from the currency?

持续高企的失业率威胁着整个欧洲一体化进程的信誉。尽管1991年的《马斯特里赫特条约》和财政紧缩政策被认为是造成高失业率的原因，但劳动力市场的僵化才是主要原因。这种僵化部分源于历史。正如美国驻法国大使费利克斯·罗哈廷所言：“密歇根州庞蒂亚克汽车公司的一名下岗工人很容易搬到达拉斯，到德州仪器公司工作。而类似的意大利工人从米兰到法兰克福，则必须跨越多个国界，使用新的语言，并将孩子送入一所陌生的学校，那里的习俗和语言都是德语，而不是意大利语。这正是欧洲劳动力流动性较低的原因。”

Persistent high unemployment threatens to undermine the credibility of the whole European venture. While the 1991 Maastricht Treaty and austerity are blamed for the high rate ofjoblessness, much of the explanation must be the inflexibility of labor markets. Part of that rigidity is defined by history. As Felix Rohatyn, U.S. ambassador to France, put the matter, “It’s relatively easy for a laid-off Pontiac worker in Michigan to move to Dallas and go to work for Texas Instruments. The analogous Italian worker going from Milan to Frankfurt has to cross several borders, operate in a new language, and put his kids into a strange school, where the customs and language are German, not Italian. That is what makes labor less mobile in Europe.”

但僵化更多地源于欧洲最引以为傲的成就之一：福利国家。福利国家在保护劳动者和非劳动者方面提供了极高的保障——远高于美国。但其高昂的成本不仅抑制了大型企业的投资，也阻碍了小型企业的创立。对福利国家的政治承诺是欧洲社会共识的基石。然而，除非福利国家的僵化得到缓解，否则欧洲将难以降低失业率。而除非失业率得到有效控制，否则欧洲人将质疑以市场为中心的政策——无论其手段是私有化、放松管制还是经济一体化——是否真的有效。7

But rigidity results even more from one of Europe’s proudest accomplishments: the welfare state. It delivers a very high degree of security—much higher than that in the United States—in terms of protection to workers and subsidies to nonworkers. But its high costs discourage not only investment by large companies but also the creation of small business. Political commitment to the welfare state is fundamental to social consensus in Europe. Yet until the rigidities of the welfare state are reduced, Europe will battle to bring down unemployment. And until that unemployment is brought down, Europeans will question whether the market focus—whether its instrument is privatization or deregulation or economic integration—is delivering the goods.7

美国：市场及其局限性

The United States: The Market and Its Limits

美国已达成新的共识。政府不再追求扩张，而是更加注重效率和财政稳健。经济监管也在重新评估。人们现在认为，公众利益可以通过竞争得到保护，政府的角色不再是取代市场运作的行政程序，而是确保建立保障竞争的框架。然而，矛盾的是，经济监管的削弱却被政府通过社会价值监管、权利和福利诉求的激增以及诉讼机制对市场进行更多干预所抵消。不过，一项重大创新是将市场机制应用于环境保护。

The United States has arrived at a new consensus. Instead of government’s expansion, the focus is now on its efficiency and on fiscal rectitude. Economic regulation is also being reassessed. It is now thought that the public can be protected through competition and that government’s role is no longer to substitute administrative processes for the workings of the market but rather to ensure the framework is in place to guarantee competition. Yet paradoxically, the diminution of economic regulation is offset by increased government intervention in the marketplace through social-value regulation, the explosion of claims to rights and entitlements, and the machinery of litigation. One major innovation, however, is the use of market mechanisms for environmental protection.

在美国，如同其他地方一样，市场体系的评判标准在于其提供的产品和服务，包括公平性、质量和成本。美国人比其他工业化国家的人民更能容忍不安全感，但他们对不安全感的容忍度也是有限的。选举和民意调查表明，虽然公众不希望政府扩大权力范围，但也不希望这个富裕的国家放弃其美式社会保障体系。

In the United States, as elsewhere, the market system will be judged by what it delivers, by fairness criteria, and by the quality and cost of services it provides. Americans are willing to tolerate more insecurity than people in other industrial nations, but there are still limits to how much insecurity they will accept. Elections and opinion polls demonstrate that while the public does not want government to extend its reach, neither does it want this rich country to abandon its American-style safety net.

就逐利动机而言，也存在局限性。例如，如果人们发现，健康维护组织中那些不露面的管理者为了追求利润，凌驾于医生的治疗和用药决定之上，那么公众无疑会强烈要求对这些组织进行更严格的审查、监管和限制。如果企业不顾华尔街的季度业绩要求，不参与到更广泛的社区和社会需求中，那么它们要么会陷入被动，要么政府会重新加强监管。至关重要的是，美国的市场体系能否惠及目前被排除在外的那部分人群，将决定其成败。

When it comes to the profit motive, there are limits as well. If it seems, for instance, that faceless managers in health maintenance organizations are, in the name of profits, overruling doctors on treatment and medication, then there can be little doubt but that the public will successfully demand that these organizations be subject to increased scrutiny, regulation, and restriction. If companies, notwithstanding the quarterly requirements of Wall Street, do not participate in the broader needs of their communities and society, either they will find themselves on the defensive or government will reextend its control. And, critically, America’s market system will be judged by its ability to include that part of the population now left out.

关键测试

Critical Tests

尽管世界各地面临的问题各不相同，但一个共同的问题凸显了从国家主导向市场主导的转变：这种转变是永久性的，还是会出现回落——国家与市场之间的界限会重新调整和校准——从而再次扩大政府的角色和责任？这当然是本书结尾最恰当的问题。当然，这个问题不可能有确切的答案。但是，人们的信仰以及他们如何解读世界——他们接受和拒绝的观念——将在未来几年对答案的形成产生重大影响。因此，我们可以提供一个框架，帮助我们随着问题的演变逐渐聚焦于答案。

However different the issues in different parts of the world, a common question underlines the shift away from state and toward the market: Is this move permanent, or will there be a shift back—a recalibration and readjustment in the boundary between state and marketplace—that expands the role and responsibilities of government once more? This is, of course, the appropriate question with which to conclude this book. Of course, there can be no definitive answer. But what people believe and how they interpret the world—the ideas they accept and those they reject—these will do much to shape the answer in the years ahead. And thus it is possible to provide a framework that will help bring the answer into focus as it evolves.

对一些人来说，拥抱市场是一种信念。对更多人来说，这是出于实际考虑，是为了找到比其他方案更好的选择。现代新加坡的缔造者李光耀一语道破了现实。当被问及为何转向市场经济时，他简洁地回答道：“共产主义崩溃了，混合经济也失败了。还能怎么办呢？” 结果至关重要。新的市场共识将以其后果来评判。

For some, the embrace of the market is a matter of conviction. For many more, it is a matter of practicality, of finding something that works better than the alternatives. Lee Kuan Yew, the progenitor of modern Singapore, summed up the reality. Asked why the turn to the market, he replied pithily, “Communism collapsed, and the mixed economy failed. What else is there?” Results count. The new market consensus will be evaluated by its consequences.

其中五项测试尤其可能对人们关于市场的思考和判断产生决定性影响。随着时间的推移，这些测试的结果将为未来国家与市场之间的界限指明方向。8

Five tests, in particular, are likely to be decisive in shaping people’s thinking and judgments about the market. The outcome of these tests will over time provide the signposts to the future frontier between state and market.8

货物交付了吗？

Delivering the Goods?

社会主义和混合经济的兴衰成败，将决定人们对市场经济的忠诚度。市场经济能否兑现其在可衡量的经济效益方面的承诺——例如经济增长、更高的生活水平、更优质的服务和就业机会？毕竟，正是市场的失灵以及人们对其能力的信心丧失，才导致政府在经济管理中扮演了更为积极的角色。

What made both socialism and the mixed economy and then discredited both will make or break the commitment to markets. Will market economies deliver on what they promise in terms of measurable economic goods—growth, higher standards of living, better quality services, and jobs? After all, it was the failure of markets and the loss of confidence in their capacity that led to governments’ assuming a much more assertive role in economic management.

如果发达国家将私有化、放松管制和经济开放视为破坏就业而非创造就业，那么自由市场政策必将持续遭受攻击并不断修正。在发展中国家，就业——以及整体经济增长率——同样至关重要。许多发展中国家面临着一个棘手的社会问题：适龄青年人口数量快速增长，但却找不到工作。如果不能让他们参与生产性劳动，经济体系乃至政治体系都将面临压力和风险。但对于发展中国家而言，衡量成功与否的最有力标准将是一个明确的指标：市场化进程在多大程度上能够提供电力、清洁用水和可靠的交通等基本生活保障。

If, in the industrialized countries, privatization, deregulation, and the opening up of economies to competition are seen as job-destroying rather than job-creating, then free-market policies will surely be subject to continuing attack and constant revision. In developing countries, too, employment—along with the overall rate of economic growth—will be critical. Many of these nations confront an explosive social issue: rapid growth in the number of young people of working age but no jobs for them. Failure to incorporate them into productive work will mean that the economic system, along with the political system, will be under stress and at risk. But for developing countries, the most telling measure of success will be a clear-cut one: the degree to which the move to the market delivers such basics as electricity, clean water, and reliable transportation.

确保公平？
