Ensuring Fairness?

经济测试结果很容易衡量，可以从国民收入表中体现出来。第二组测试结果虽然无法用数字表达，但其重要性丝毫不减。它触及人们评判世界、评判他们所生活的制度以及评判自身命运的基本价值观。对许多人来说，市场体系的评价不仅在于其经济成就，还在于这种成就的分配方式。这种成就的惠及范围有多广？这个体系是否公平公正？还是说，它不成比例地让富人和贪婪者受益，而牺牲了勤劳普通民众的利益？它是否善待所有人，是否包容了弱势群体和被剥夺权利者？是否存在公平、公正和机会？

The economic tests are eminently measurable; they can be counted in national income tables. The second set of tests cannot be expressed in figures, but it is no less powerful. It goes to the basic values by which people judge the world, the system in which they live, and their own lot. For many, the market system will be evaluated not only by its economic success but by the way in which that success is distributed. How widely shared is the success? Is the system fair and just? Or does it disproportionately benefit the rich and the avaricious at the expense of the hardworking of more moderate circumstances? Does it treat people decently, and does it include the disenfranchised and the disadvantaged? Are there equity, fair play, and opportunity?

市场体系本质上就面临着公平问题。由于其运作机制，以及其赖以生存的激励机制本身的性质，市场体系造成的收入不平等程度远高于那些平等主义价值观根深蒂固的管制型社会。然而，公平和正义的观念根深蒂固，本身就是强大的驱动力。在英国，托尼·布莱尔的伟大成就之一，就是将社会民主主义的公平和包容价值观与撒切尔主义的经济纲领融合在一起。

Market systems, by their very nature, confront the question of fairness. Because of their dynamics, and indeed the very nature of the incentives on which they depend for motivation, they generate a much greater range of inequality of income than more controlled societies in which egalitarian values are so strong. But notions of fairness and justice run very deep and are powerful motivators in their own right. In Britain, Tony Blair’s great accomplishment was to fuse social-democratic values of fairness and inclusiveness with the Thatcherite economic program.

财富过度集中会削弱市场导向型体系所需的合法性。当然，关键在于“过度”一词，这完全是主观的。市场拥护者所谓的“激励”，在市场批评者的语境中却被解读为“贪婪”。炫耀性消费和财富的摆布使天平向“贪婪”倾斜，从而加剧了对不平等的批判。美国社会对收入不平等的容忍度远高于其他国家。对此，有很多解释——从缺乏社会民主传统，到坚信海平面上升确实会抬升所有船只，再到效仿霍雷肖·阿尔杰的传统，推崇勇气和进取心。然而，即使在美国，可接受的程度也肯定有其限度。至少彼得是这么警告的。德鲁克是现代资本主义领域最具影响力的思想家之一。他被认为是“私有化”一词的创造者，如今他预见到美国将会出现一股针对富人的“怨恨和蔑视”。他说：“我不知道它会以何种形式出现，但当经济周期再次下行时，人们对巨额财富产生的嫉妒之情将会引发麻烦。”

Excessive concentration of wealth will undercut the legitimacy that a market-oriented system requires. Of course, the operative word is the altogether subjective excessive. What a market advocate describes as “incentives” is translated into “greed” in the vocabulary of a market critic. Conspicuous consumption and the flaunting of wealth weigh the scale toward “greed” and thus accentuate the criticism of inequality. American society accepts much greater income inequality than others. For this, there are many explanations—from the lack of a social-democratic tradition to the confidence that a rising sea really does lift all boats to the celebration of pluck and initiative in the tradition of Horatio Alger. Yet surely there are limits to what is acceptable even in the United States. At least so warns Peter Drucker, one of the most influential modern thinkers on capitalism. Drucker, credited with inventing the word privatization, now foresees a coming backlash of “bitterness and contempt” against the rich in the United States. “I don’t know what form it will take,” he said, “but the envy developing [in reaction to] enormous wealth will cause trouble” when the business cycle turns down again.

对许多人来说，无论身处哪个国家，极端的不平等不仅会加剧不满，还会让人联想到隐藏的阴谋和秘密交易——简而言之，就是富人滥用权力。私有化在这方面尤其敏感：当国有资产转移到私人所有者手中时，谁会从中受益？然而，私有化也受到另一股强大趋势的推动。在全球范围内，由于资本市场发生深刻变革——所有权分散化——私有化将更容易被接受。养老基金从现收现付的政府养老金体系转向基于储蓄的养老基金，这意味着私有化企业的主要所有者将不再是少数富裕家族或大资本家，而是通过股票市场和直接投资动员起来的现有和未来退休人员的储蓄总和。这为私有化提供了日益扩大的合法性，而这种合法性在25年前是不存在的。

For many, whatever the country, extreme inequality not only fans discontent but also suggests hidden cabals and secret strings—in short, the abuse of power by those with the wealth. Privatization is particularly sensitive in this regard: Who benefits as state-owned assets are transferred to private owners? Yet privatization is bolstered by another powerful trend. Globally, it will become more accepted owing to a profound change in capital markets—toward diffusion of ownership. The shift to pension funds based upon savings—as opposed to pay-as-you-go government pension systems—means that the preponderant owners of privatized firms will be not a few very rich families or big-time capitalists but rather the aggregated savings of present and future retirees, mobilized through stock markets and direct investment. This provides an expanding legitimacy for privatization that would not have existed a quarter century ago.

对制度公平性的信心取决于法律体系的有效性和经济运行规则的透明度。腐败是这种信心的致命敌人。它侵蚀了市场赖以生存的信任这一道德基石。诚然，传统国家控制型经济体的制度结构使其成为滋生腐败的温床。毕竟，掌握关键决策权的是政府官员——不仅是高层官员，还有那些收入微薄的公务员。但是，在那些从国家控制转向市场经济、释放资产并创造新机遇的经济体中，也存在着大量滋生腐败的机会。9

Confidence in the fairness of the system depends upon the effectiveness of the legal system and the transparency of the rules by which the economy operates. Corruption is a deadly enemy of such confidence. It corrodes the moral bedrock of trust upon which markets depend. To be sure, the institutional setup in traditional state-controlled economies made them fertile spawning grounds for corruption. After all, it was government officials—not only those at the top but also woefully underpaid civil servants—who called the critical shots. But there is also plenty of opportunity for corruption in economies that are releasing assets and creating new opportunities as they move from state control to market focus.9

维护国家认同？

Upholding National Identity?

对许多国家而言，参与新的全球经济是一把双刃剑。它促进经济增长，带来新技术和新机遇，但也挑战着国家和地区文化的价值观和认同。它可能会削弱人们传统而令人安心的安全感——无论是欧洲高度的就业保障，还是亚洲的社会规则，亦或是家庭、合作以及年轻人应该接触的价值观。许多国家的人民可能并不认为他们的文化生活应该被来自西方的卫星媒体所主导，这些媒体将好莱坞和纽约的价值观全球化。他们也认为，他们的公司不应该受到所谓的“盎格鲁-撒克逊式股东价值崇拜”的束缚，这种崇拜会无情地剥夺其他社会视为社会义务和责任的那些东西。责任。如果这些攻击过于猛烈或反击过于激烈，那么那些已经降低关税和其他进口壁垒的国家可能会以新一轮的民族主义和新的规章制度及限制措施作为回应。它们无需重新实行国有化就能维护主权和控制权。

For many countries, participation in the new global economy is very much a mixed blessing. It promotes economic growth and brings new technologies and new opportunities. But it also challenges the values and identities of national and regional cultures. It can undermine a traditional and comforting sense of security—whether it is the high degree ofjob security in Europe or the social rules in Asia, or indeed values about family and cooperation and to what the young ought be exposed. People in a number of countries may not believe that their cultural life should be dominated by the satellite-borne media images from the West that globalize the values of Hollywood and New York. Nor, they argue, should their companies be subjected to what has been called the “Anglo-Saxon cult of shareholder value,” which would ruthlessly cut away what are seen in other societies as social obligations and responsibilities. If these assaults are too strong or the reaction too bitter, then countries that have reduced their tariffs and other import barriers may respond with renewed nationalism and new barriers in the form of regulations and restrictions. They will not have to renationalize in order to assert sovereignty and control.

金融市场的相互关​​联在促进投资流动的同时，也使各国经济极易受到重大冲击和动荡的影响，这不禁令人质疑参与全球经济的真正意义。领导人和民众震惊地发现，一个国家数十年来辛勤耕耘、付出巨大牺牲所积累的20%到30%的经济价值，竟能在短短几周内化为乌有。

The interconnection of financial markets, while promoting investment flows, also makes national economies vulnerable to major shocks and turbulence that call into question what participation in the global economy actually means. Leaders and publics are stunned to see how 20 or 30 percent of a country’s economic value, built up over decades by the hard work and sacrifice of the nation, can be destroyed in a matter of weeks.

然而，这种对金融脆弱性的新关注也揭示了一种变化——危险来自资本市场，而非几年前还被视为最大威胁的跨国公司。事实上，人们对跨国公司的看法已经发生了很大的改变。它们不再被视为掠夺者，而是被视为投资者，能够带来资本、技术、技能和进入全球市场的渠道。它们不再被视为威胁的原因还有其他方面；这不仅是因为它们的数量庞大——根据联合国的一项统计，超过四万家——还因为它们的母国背景各异。

Yet this new focus on financial vulnerability also reveals a change—that the danger comes from the capital markets, not from multinational corporations, which were seen as the great threat not so many years ago. Indeed, the perspective on multinationals is quite altered. Instead of being seen as predators, they are now courted as investors, who bring capital, technology, skills, and access to global markets. They are also seen as less threatening for other reasons; it is not only because there are now so many of them—over forty thousand, according to one United Nations count—but also because their home countries are so diverse.

但这并不意味着不会出现对外国控制和外国所有权的抵触情绪，尤其是在那些被视为与国家认同过于密切和核心的行业。地方参与和伙伴关系有助于缓解此类冲突，使各方受益。但跨国公司与国家价值观之间仍将存在利益冲突和固有的紧张关系。这种冲突源于二者视角和利益群体的根本差异。毕竟，政府的职责是回应国家利益和关切，而跨国公司则受国际视野的驱动。

This does not mean, however, that there will not be renewed hostility to foreign control and to foreign ownership of domestic industries, particularly industries that are seen as too close and too central to national identity. Local participation and partnerships can help alleviate such conflict, to everybody’s benefit. But there will continue to be a clash of interests and inherent tension between multinational corporations and national values. The conflict arises from their fundamental difference in perspective and constituencies. Government’s job, after all, is to respond to national interests and concerns, while the multinational unit is driven by the imperatives of an international perspective.

保护环境？

Securing the Environment?

经过二十五年多的努力，环境保护已稳固地确立为国家和国际优先事项。经济体系将以其应对各种环境问题的措施来评判，并将被迫寻求进一步的改进和新的解决方案。

After more than a quarter century of activism, the environment is firmly ensconced as both a national and an international priority. Economic systems will be judged by how they respond to the wide range of environmental concerns, and they will be compelled to find further improvements and new solutions.

对工业化世界而言，这意味着继续沿着已经取得显著进展的道路前进。与20世纪70年代初相比，工业化世界的8.5亿人口的国民生活环境已得到显著改善。这得益于立法和监管、创新和技术、实践和行为的改变，以及大量的投入。这是一笔巨额资金。但如何推进呢？是通过指令控制和熟悉的监管方式，还是通过创新的市场体系？

For the industrial world, this means continuing on a track along which it is already well advanced. Compared to where they started at the beginning of the 1970s, the 850 hundred million people of the industrial world have experienced dramatic improvements in their national environments. This has been accomplished through legislation and regulation, innovation and technology, changes in practices and behavior—and by spending a great deal of money. But how to go forward? Will it be through command-andcontrol and familiar forms of regulation or through innovative market-based systems?

最紧迫的环境问题影响着世界其他地区的47.5亿人口。这些国家中许多都处于较低的环境标准水平。贫困加剧了这些国家的环境压力——例如，在许多国家，农村贫困人口为了获取柴火而砍伐森林，造成了一系列问题，包括严重破坏农业的土壤侵蚀。此外，各国在追求经济增长的过程中也面临着环境问题——工厂和发电厂缺乏防护措施导致城市空气污染严重、汽车保有量激增以及劣质燃料的使用。这些问题可以得到缓解，但代价高昂，尤其对于那些努力提高收入、需求众多但资源有限的国家而言更是如此。如何调动投资？谁来承担这些成本？这样的选择并非发展中国家独有。共产主义遗留的持久问题之一是前苏联和东欧地区遭受的广泛环境破坏。然而，这些前共产主义国家既缺乏经济资源，也缺乏解决环境问题的手段。

The most pressing environmental issues are those that affect the 4.75 billion people in the rest of the world. A large number of those countries start from low levels of standards. Their environments are under stress because of poverty—for example, in many countries, the rural poor have cut down forests for firewood, creating a host of difficulties, including erosion that cripples agriculture. Countries also suffer from the environmental problems that come from climbing on the growth ladder—wretched urban air from unprotected factories and power plants, proliferating automobiles, and poor-quality fuels. These problems can be ameliorated, but the price tag is high, especially for a country that is struggling to raise its income and has many needs but limited resources. How will investment be mobilized? Who will pay the price? Such choices are not limited to developing countries. One of the lasting legacies of communism is the extensive environmental damage that afflicts the former Soviet Union and Eastern Europe. But neither the economic resources nor the means are readily available to remedy the ills in the former communist world.

然而，环境问题正日益国际化。有些是区域性问题。例如，印尼森林焚烧造成的严重空气污染会波及数百英里之外的马来西亚、新加坡和泰国。有些则是全球性问题，气候变化便是其中最广为人知的例子。正如气候变化辩论所表明的那样，首要挑战在于就问题的严重程度达成初步共识。但这仅仅是开始。接下来，众多国家必须就解决方案达成共识。然后，它们将面临分配责任和成本的艰巨任务。

Increasingly, however, environmental issues are becoming international. Some are regional matters. The burning of forests in Indonesia creates terrible air pollution hundreds of miles away, in Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand. Some issues are global, and climate change is the best known. As the climate-change debate demonstrates, the first challenge is to come to some rough agreement on the dimensions of the problem. But that is only the beginning. For a multitude of nations then have to come to a meeting of the minds on solutions. Then they face the difficult job of apportioning responsibilities and costs.

在这些问题上，发达国家和发展中国家之间发生冲突的可能性相当大。发达国家呼吁采取协调一致的行动，在发展中国家看来，可能是一种限制其发展机会的举措——这种限制是由比它们富裕得多的国家强加的。例如，发达国家对中国燃煤发电的碳排放量表示担忧。中国则回应说，按人均计算，他们的用电量仅为美国的5%。他们质问道，为什么他们不能有机会追求更高的生活水平？即使实现了更高的生活水平，也仍然只是发达国家生活水平的一小部分。

In such matters, the potential for conflict between developed and developing countries is considerable. Calls for concerted action by the industrial countries can appear to developing nations as an effort to constrain their growth opportunities—imposed by countries much richer than themselves. The industrial world, for instance, expresses concern at the absolute amounts of carbon emitted by coal-fired electric generation in China. The Chinese reply by observing that on a per capita basis, they use only 5 percent as much electric power as Americans. How, they ask, can they be denied the opportunity to strive toward a higher standard of living, which, even if achieved, will still be only a fraction of that in the developed countries?

在此过程中，私营部门将承担日益重要的环境责任。企业不仅要受到来自多方和多个机构的监管，还要根据其对改善环境的承诺和贡献来接受评判。关注环境问题将成为高层管​​理人员日益重要的责任。

In all this, the private sector will find itself carrying an increasing environmental role. Not only will companies be regulated from a multitude of directions and by multiple authorities; they will also find themselves judged by the nature of their commitment and contribution to improving the environment. Focusing on the environment will become a growing responsibility of senior management.

如何应对人口结构变化？

Coping with Demographics?

人口趋势将对市场经济的运行构成挑战。发展中国家的人口问题尤为突出。这些国家面临着年轻人口的急剧增长，以及创造就业机会和提高人均收入的艰巨任务。人口激增导致闲散、贫困、失望和怨恨等问题交织在一起，极易引发政治和经济不稳定。随着时间的推移，收入增长将导致出生率下降。与此同时，自由化经济体将难以为其民众创造更多机会。人口增长的影响不仅限于国界之内。因为人口增长还会推动人口在这些国家之间以及向发达国家迁移，从而引发新的政治和社会冲突。

Population trends will challenge the performance of market economies. The more familiar population issue is in the developing world. Those countries confront an enormous swelling in the younger age groups and the daunting tasks of generating jobs and increasing per capita income. The surge in population creates a combustible mixture of idleness, poverty, disillusionment, and bitterness that can be a tremendous source of political and economic instability. Over time, growth in incomes will lead to a tapering-off of births. In the meantime, liberalized economies will struggle to generate opportunities for their populace. The effects are not limited within borders. For population growth also drives migration both among these countries and into industrial nations, creating new political and social conflicts.

对于发达国家而言，人口结构的关键趋势是老龄化程度的不断提高，这将加剧改革传统福利制度的迫切需求。关键时期将从21世纪第一个十年末开始，届时婴儿潮一代将开始退休，给医疗和养老金体系带来巨大压力。随着时间的推移，这些压力将愈发严峻。经济学家戴维·黑尔表示：“毫无疑问，21世纪最大的经济政策挑战将是如何为所有人的退休生活提供资金。”他补充道：“人口老龄化带来的财政挑战之巨大，唯一能与之相提并论的莫过于战争。”

For the developed world, the key population trend is the growing proportion of the elderly, which will add to the critical need to reform the traditional welfare state. The key period will begin toward the end of the first decade of the twenty-first century, when the baby-boom generation starts to retire, putting enormous strains on the health and pension systems. The pressures will grow more severe as the years pass. “There can be little doubt,” said economist David Hale, “that the great economic policy challenge of the twenty-first century will be how to finance everyone’s retirement.” He added, “The only good analogy to the magnitude of the fiscal challenge posed by the aging of … population is war.”

退休和医疗保健的成本将落在谁的肩上，落在哪个年龄段？政府（进而纳税人）将承担多少责任，个人和私营部门又将承担多少责任？人们完全可以预见，围绕医疗保健和养老金问题，代际之间将爆发政治冲突。选民会投票扩大政府的作用，增加国民收入中用于满足老年人需求的份额，而劳动人口则会发现，他们越来越多的劳动产出将被征税，用于赡养老年人。每个社会面临的挑战在于，如何区分哪些属于应由公共资金支付的“权利”，哪些属于个人应承担的“市场服务”。在下一个世纪，随着老龄化这一严峻挑战也成为发展中国家面临的问题，发展中国家和发达国家的人口问题将趋于一致。到2030年，中国65岁以上的人口将达到4亿，而目前这一数字为1亿。

On whose shoulders, on which age group, will the costs of retirement and health care fall? How much responsibility will belong to government, and thus to taxpayers, and how much will be the responsibility of individuals and the private sector? One can well imagine political conflict along generational lines over health care and pensions. The votes will be there to expand government’s role and the share of the national income going to meet the needs of the elderly, and the working population will find an increasing proportion of its output being taxed away to support the older generation. The challenge for each society will be to sort out what it considers entitlements, to be paid out of public funds, and what it regards simply as marketable services, for which the individual is responsible. In the next century, the population issues for the developing and developed countries will converge as the daunting challenge of the elderly becomes a problem for developing countries as well. By the year 2030, China will have 400 million people over the age of sixty-five, compared to 100 million today.

信心的平衡

The Balance of Confidence

这些考验能否成功，很大程度上取决于世界各地的公众如何应对指挥格局的巨大转变。当前形势正处于上升期。人们对市场体系的信心会得到巩固，还是会遭到削弱？毕竟，信心才是问题的核心。世界正持续向市场化转型。最显著的迹象之一是，世界各地的人们将储蓄和退休保障寄托于股市的程度。在美国，这一趋势显然处于领先地位，到1997年中期，共同基金的资产比银行账户的资产高出25%。同样，随着私有化和放松管制，政府正在将原本属于其管辖的领域移交给市场。然而，结果并非总是可控的。波动性和风险是固有的。要想建立稳固的信心，就需要对可能出现的问题进行现实的评估。10

How successfully these tests will be met will have much to do with how publics around the world respond to the great shift in the commanding heights that is now unfolding. Will confidence in market systems be reaffirmed, or will it be eroded? And confidence, after all, is the heart of the matter. As it is, the world continues to move toward markets. One of the most dramatic signs is the degree to which people around the world are entrusting their savings and their retirements to the stock market. In the United States, which is clearly at the forefront, mutual fund assets by mid-1997 exceeded assets in bank accounts by 25 percent. Similarly, with privatization and deregulation, governments are turning over what had been their province to the marketplace. Yet there is nothing guaranteed about the results. Volatility and risk are inherent. If confidence is to be well grounded, it requires a realistic assessment of what can go wrong.10

在所有危险中，对新共识及其赖以维系的信心而言，或许最大的威胁来自国际金融体系的大规模动荡。资本市场的增长速度远远超过了监管能力，甚至超过了对其的理解能力。一体化全球市场的规模和影响范围本身就造成了前所未有的金融风险。这些危险源于货币市场、利率市场和股票市场的相互关​​联，以及依赖于这些市场的各种辅助市场的惊人增长。过去，金融恐慌的爆发往往需要数周甚至数月的时间。而现在，危机可以在数小时内席卷全球市场，危及整个金融体系。诚然，金融市场种类繁多，在许多情况下，其规模庞大且流动性极强。真正的危险并非源于单一冲击的可能性，而是源于多种冲击同时汇聚，并在整个体系中产生连锁反应。

Of all the dangers, perhaps the greatest threat to the new consensus, and the confidence that underlies it, would arise from massive disruption of the international financial system. Capital markets are growing far faster than the capacity to regulate them—or indeed even to understand them. The very scope and reach of the integrated global markets create financial risks on an unprecedented scale. These dangers result from the interconnection of currency markets, interest rates, and stock markets, along with the extraordinary growth in the various ancillary markets that hinge on them. In the past, financial panics took weeks or even months to unfold. Now contagion can sweep through the world’s markets in hours, endangering the entire edifice. To be sure, the financial markets are diverse and, in many cases, dense and enormously liquid. The danger arises not from the possibility of a shock but rather from the convergence of several shocks at one time that together reverberate through the entire system.

这种趋同的可能性或许很低。但是，正如撒切尔夫人用“撒切尔定律”提醒人们的那样，意想不到的事情确实会发生。过去十年间，各种严重的冲击层出不穷。1995年，拉丁美洲遭受了墨西哥货币贬值引发的“龙舌兰酒效应”；两年后，1997年，东南亚爆发了一场大规模的货币危机，其根源在于疲软且过度杠杆化的银行业。这两起事件都导致了恐慌性抛售和股市崩盘。1996年，鲍里斯·叶利钦可能在总统选举中败给一位共产主义对手，这一政治危机给俄罗斯经济带来了巨大冲击。始于1990年伊拉克入侵科威特的波斯湾军事危机震动了世界股市。在日本，20世纪90年代初泡沫破裂后，商业和消费者信心的崩溃是导致该国长期经济衰退的主要原因之一。其中一些事件的发生完全出乎意料。但它们各自或多或少都是孤立发生的，并被其他方面的力量所抵消。危险不在于某一种冲击的发生，而在于不幸的巧合。

The probability of such convergence may be low. But, as Margaret Thatcher reminds one with Thatcher’s Law, the unexpected does happen. There has been no shortage of severe shocks over the last decade. In 1995, Latin America suffered from the “tequila effect” resulting from Mexico’s devaluation; two years later, in 1997, Southeast Asia underwent a massive currency crisis that started in a weak and overleveraged banking sector. Both resulted in panic selling and stock market collapses. A political crisis—the prospect in 1996 that Boris Yeltsin might lose the presidential election to a communist rival—sent shock waves through the Russian economy. The Persian Gulf military crisis, which began with Iraq’s invasion of Kuwait in 1990, shook the world’s stock exchanges. And in Japan, the breakdown in business and consumer confidence after the bubble broke in the early 1990s has been one of the main reasons for the long slump that settled over the country. Some of these came as complete surprises. But each of them occurred more or less in isolation and was offset by strength elsewhere. The danger is not that one or the other type of shock takes place. The threat is of an unlucky conjunction.

当然，如果这种情况真的发生，国家和国际当局绝不会袖手旁观。他们可以动用所有可用的危机管理机制，包括正式的、非正式的和正式的。非正式的，以及过去一个世纪以来汲取的所有经验教训，都是为了恢复稳定、组织救助并扭转局面。但此类问题的复杂性和范围可能超过以往任何经验。一切结束后，市场最终可能会在远低于目前的水平上重新稳定下来。与此同时，数万亿美元的财富将蒸发殆尽。流动性问题很可能普遍存在，一些大型金融机构的风险敞口远超其自身认知，可能濒临破产。其后果可能是经济长期低迷，甚至出现通货紧缩，从而导致保护主义卷土重来。相互指责和怨恨将充斥市场。最终结果：人们对市场本身的信心全面崩溃。

Of course, national and international authorities would not be watching from the sidelines should such a compounding occur. They could use all the considerable crisis-management machinery available to them, both formal and informal, all the lessons learned over the century, in order to restore steadiness, organize bailouts, and turn the tide. But the complexity and range of such problems could exceed any previous experience. When it is all over, markets might end up restabilized at much lower levels. In the meantime, trillions of dollars of wealth would have evaporated. Liquidity problems would likely be widespread, and some large financial institutions, much more exposed than they had recognized, could teeter on bankruptcy. The consequence could be a protracted period of poor economic performance, even deflation, inviting a return to protectionism. Recrimination and bitterness would abound. The result: a wholesale retreat from confidence in markets themselves.

金融市场已超越国界和传统监管的束缚。但各国政府和国际机构之间的协调与沟通有助于识别并管控薄弱环节，避免其演变成蔓延成灾的危机。我们需要开发新的方法来跟上全球资本市场的发展步伐。这意味着各国政府需要提高其财政状况的透明度，企业——尤其是关键金融领域的企业——需要加强信息披露。投资者和贷款机构需要保持清醒的头脑，评估各种风险，并在考虑全球市场的同时，牢记国家和地区的政治、文化和历史现实。简而言之，市场共识的最佳维系并非依靠热情，而是依靠审慎的策略。

Financial markets have transcended national boundaries and traditional regulation. But coordination and communication among governments and international institutions can help identify and manage weaknesses before they give rise to contagions that turn into epidemics. New methods need to be developed to keep pace with the growth of the global capital markets. That means more transparency by governments in terms of their financial positions and more disclosure by companies—in particular, by firms in the critical financial sector. Investors and lenders need to maintain a clear-eyed assessment of perils and keep in mind, even as they think about global markets, the realities of national and regional politics, culture, and history. In short, the market consensus is best bolstered not by enthusiasm but by a measured prudence.

市场还需要另一种东西：合法性。但在这里，它面临着一个伦理难题。市场建立在契约、规则和选择之上——简而言之，建立在自我约束之上——这与其他经济活动组织方式截然不同。然而，一个以追求自身利益和利润为指导原则的体系，未必能满足人类灵魂深处对信仰和超越物质主义的更高意义的渴望。据说，在20世纪30年代末的西班牙内战中，共和军士兵临终前口中念念有词地喊着“斯大林”。他们对苏联共产主义的理想化愿景，无论多么错误，都为他们最终的牺牲提供了正当理由。很少有人会临终前口中念念有词地喊着“自由市场” 。

The market also requires something else: legitimacy. But here it faces an ethical conundrum. It is based upon contracts, rules, and choice—in short, on self-restraint—which contrasts mightily with other ways of organizing economic activity. Yet a system that takes the pursuit of self-interest and profit as its guiding light does not necessarily satisfy the yearning in the human soul for belief and some higher meaning beyond materialism. In the Spanish Civil War in the late 1930s, Republican soldiers are said to have died with the word Stalin on their lips. Their idealized vision of Soviet communism, however misguided, provided justification for their ultimate sacrifice. Few people would die with the words free markets on their lips.

即使抛开这种极端对比，社会主义和国家干预的道德诉求也清晰明确：利他主义；对同胞的关怀、同情和团结；尊严和社会进步；正义和公平；希望。市场体系无法提供如此直接的诉求。它的道德基础更为微妙——也更为间接——体现在它所创造的可能性，而非它实际做了什么。

Even without that extreme contrast, the moral appeal of socialism and state intervention is clear and explicit: altruism; concern, sympathy, and solidarity with fellow humans; dignity and social betterment; justice and fairness; hope. The market system cannot offer such direct appeals. Its moral basis is more subtle—and indirect—in terms of what it makes possible rather than what it does.

然而，市场的本质道德体现在两个方面。首先，体现在市场带来的结果，体现在它为人们创造的可能性——这基于这样一个前提：个人利益的追求最终会促进社会的整体进步。毕竟，这正是亚当·斯密论证利己主义的核心所在。其次，体现在人们坚信，基于财产、契约和主动性的体系能够提供保护。反对国家任意且不受制约的权力。这两个前提是市场经济的基石，随着时间的推移，市场运作的成效也将以此为标准进行评估。这两个前提并不意味着所有价值都是市场价值，也不意味着人类的努力只能以其在商业领域获得的收益来评判。广阔的活动领域需要用不同于金钱的视角来衡量和激励。这里要表达的是，组织经济以实现目标的方式有好有坏。选择以市场为导向并不意味着拥抱金钱文化。

Yet the essential morality of the market is twofold. The first is in the results that it delivers, in what it makes possible for people—which is based upon the premise that the pursuit of individual interest cumulatively adds up to the overall betterment of society. That was, after all, at the heart of Adam Smith’s argument for self-interest. The second lies in the conviction that a system based upon property, contracts, and initiative provides protection against the arbitrary and unchecked power of the state. Those two premises are the bedrock of the market, and it is against them, over time, that the workings of the market will be evaluated. Neither of these premises implies that all values are market values, that human endeavor is to be judged only by what it fetches in the commercial arena. Large realms of activity are to be valued—and motivated—in terms that are distinct from dollars and cents. What is being said is that there are better and worse ways to organize economies to achieve objectives. To choose the market focus is not to embrace a money culture.

然而，如果市场在上述两个方面——结果和约束——被认为失效，如果其利益被视为排他性的而非包容性的，如果其被认为助长了滥用私人权力和赤裸裸的贪婪，那么必然会出现反弹——国家将重新加强干预、管理和控制。国家将再次挺身而出，扩大其作为公民保护者的角色，以对抗私人利益的权力，无论这种权力是通过垄断、肆意妄为、欺诈和欺骗，还是剥削和直接伤害来行使的。

Yet if the market is seen to fail on either of those two grounds—results and restraint—if its benefits are regarded as exclusive rather than as inclusive, if it is seen to nurture the abuse of private power and the specter of raw greed, then surely there will be a backlash—a return to greater state intervention, management, and control. The state would again step forward to expand its role as protector of the citizenry against the power of private interests, whether exercised through monopoly, wanton behavior, fraud and deception, or exploitation and direct harm.

与此同时，在一场宏大的戏剧中，国家正不断从权力中心退却，将越来越多的权力拱手让给市场。这象征着一次伟大的重新连接——二十世纪的开端与终结的交汇。世纪之初，市场经济蓬勃发展，全球经济扩张，乐观主义精神为其注入活力。然而，战争、萧条、民族主义和意识形态的冲突撕裂了当时的经济。危机与灾难、人类的需求与苦难，以及对正义与尊严的深刻追求——这些都推动了国家责任的扩展。二战后的几十年是复苏与高速增长的时期。今天的种种可能性都建立在昨日的成就之上。但如今，由于经验的积累和重新评估——以及技术的进步——国家的角色正在被重新定义，市场领域也在不断扩张。由此引发了一系列棘手的问题：国家应该提供哪些服务？它在福利方面扮演着怎样的角色？其经济的“混合”程度又将降低到何种程度？

In the meanwhile, in a vast drama, the state continues to withdraw from the commanding heights, leaving it more and more to the realm of the market. This represents a great reconnecting—a conjoining of the beginning and the end of the twentieth century. The century opened with markets ascendant and an expanding global economy, buttressed by a spirit of optimism. That economy was fractured by war, depression, nationalism, and ideology. Crisis and disaster, human need and suffering, and a profound sense of justice and dignity—these propelled the expansion of the state’s responsibilities. The decades after World War II were years of recovery and then of great growth. Today’s possibilities are built on those achievements of yesterday. But now, because of experience and reassessment—and also because of technology—the role of the state is being redefined, and the realm of the market is now expanding. Hard questions result: What services should the state provide? What is its welfare role? And how much less “mixed” will its economy be?

这些变化标志着第一个真正意义上的全球经济的建立——一个一体化、互联互通的经济体，工作和生产在全球范围内联网，从知识到商业的一切都以电子形式呈现。尽管市场经济的复兴带来了诸多益处和无限希望，但它在21世纪仍将面临一系列新的挑战和严峻考验。它能为人们创造的机遇是巨大的；然而，人们对它的需求、影响以及可能带来的秩序重塑也存在着明显的担忧。风险将成为这个新世界中一个显而易见的组成部分，而且理应如此。因为正是风险孕育了创新、激励机制以及想象力，推动着世界不断向前发展。

These changes signify the establishment of the first truly global economy,-integrated and interconnected, in which work and production are networked around the world, and in which everything from knowledge to commerce is taking electronic form. With all its benefits and all the hopes it sparks, this reassertion of the market will nevertheless encounter a host of new challenges and bracing tests in the twenty-first century. The opportunities it can create for people are enormous; yet there is a clear unease with its demands, its impact, and the reordering that it can impose. Risk will be a very evident part of this new world, as it should be. For it is out of risk that emerge the innovation and the incentives—and the imagination—that carry the world forward.

推动国家控制向市场共识转变的因素有很多——但从根本上讲，它建立在信仰和观念的重塑之上——从对国家的传统信任转向对市场更高的信任度。那么，真正决定这种转变能否持续，或者是否会出现回落的，或许在于支撑市场的信心的质量和性质。如果信心能够建立在对风险和不确定性，以及对市场及其价值的益处和局限性的现实评估之上，那么它就更有可能持久。未来国家与市场之间的界限将在哪里？答案将在不断积累的判断和经验中找到，这些判断和经验将引导人们的信念，并塑造信心的平衡。

Many forces are driving the shift from state control to market consensus.-Yet fundamentally it rests upon a recasting of beliefs and ideas—away from the traditional faith in the state and toward greater credibility for the market. Perhaps, then, what will really determine whether this change will persist, or whether there will be a swing back, is the quality and character of the confidence that underpins the marketplace. Confidence is more likely to endure if it is tempered by a realistic appraisal of risk and uncertainty, and of the benefits and limits of the market and its values. And where will fall the future frontier between state and market? That answer will be found in the cumulative judgments and experience that will orient beliefs and shape the balance of confidence.

时间顺序

 

CHRONOLOGY

 

1776年，亚当·斯密出版了《国富论》。

1776   Adam Smith publishes The Wealth of Nations.

美国革命爆发。

American Revolution begins.

1789年法国大革命爆发。

1789   French Revolution begins.

1867 马克思开始出版《资本论》

1867   Marx begins to publish Das Kapital

1882年，俾斯麦在德国建立了养老金制度。

1882   Bismarck establishes pension system in Germany.

1887年，美国成立了州际商务委员会。

1887   Interstate Commerce Commission established in the United States.

1890 年美国《谢尔曼反垄断法》。

1890   Sherman Anti-Trust Act in the United States.

1901年，西奥多·罗斯福当选美国总统，并开始“反垄断”。

1901   Theodore Roosevelt becomes U.S. president and starts “trust-busting.”

1906 年英国改革自由政府为“救护车国家”奠定了基础。

1906   Reforming Liberal government in Britain lays basis for “ambulance state.”

1911年中国革命。

1911   Chinese Revolution.

1914年第一次世界大战爆发，结束了国际贸易的“黄金时代”。

1914   Outbreak of First World War ends “golden age” of international commerce.

1917年俄国革命爆发。

1917   Russian Revolution begins.

1918年，第一次世界大战结束。

1918   World War I ends.

1919年《凡尔赛条约》。

1919   Treaty of Versailles.

英国工党通过第四条款，呼吁国有化。

British Labour Party adopts Clause IV, calling for nationalization.

印度阿姆利则惨案。

Amritsar massacre in India.

北京天安门广场的示威活动开启了中国的“五四”民族主义运动。

Tiananmen Square demonstration in Beijing launches “May 4” nationalist movement in China.

1921-22 年列宁的“新经济政策”允许一些私人经济活动。

1921-22   Lenin’s “New Economic Policy” permits some private economic activity.

他以“制高点”理论回应批评者。路德维希·冯·米塞斯在维也纳出版了《论社会主义》 。

He replies to critics with “commanding heights” theory. Ludwig von Mises publishes On Socialism in Vienna.

1927年，斯大林巩固了对苏联的统治。

1927   Stalin consolidates control in Soviet Union.

1929年美国股市崩盘标志着大萧条的开始。

1929   U.S. stock market crash signals onset of Great Depression.

苏联第一个五年计划。

First five-year plan in Soviet Union.

1932年，塞缪尔·英萨尔在美国的电力帝国崩溃了。

1932   Samuel Insull’s electric power empire collapses in the United States.

1933年，富兰克林·罗斯福就任美国总统，并推行新政。

1933   Franklin Roosevelt becomes U.S. president, launching New Deal.

墨索里尼的法西斯政权在意大利创建了IRI（意大利国家工业公司），作为一家国有控股公司。

Mussolini’s Fascist regime creates IRI as state holding company in Italy.

1933-35年美国证券交易委员会和田纳西州成立

1933-35   Establishment of U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and Tennessee

山谷管理局，以及《公共事业控股公司法》的通过。

Valley Authority, and passage of Public Utility Holding Company Act.

1934-35年，毛泽东领导中国共产党进行了长征。

1934-35   Mao Zedong leads China’s communists on the Long March.

1936年，约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯出版了《通论》。

1936   John Maynard Keynes publishes The General Theory.

1937年，日本与中国之间的战争爆发。

1937   War between Japan and China begins.

1938年，墨西哥将石油工业国有化。

1938   Mexico nationalizes its oil industry.

美国民用航空委员会的成立是为了应对美国航空业的“极端竞争”。

Civil Aeronautics Board is created to deal with “extreme competition” in U.S. aviation.

1939年，第二次世界大战在欧洲爆发，德国入侵波兰。

1939   World War II starts in Europe with German invasion of Poland.

1941年，珍珠港事件发生后的第二天，美国正式加入第二次世界大战。

1941   U.S. enters World War II the day after Pearl Harbor attack.

阿尔蒂埃罗·斯皮内利被法西斯分子囚禁在文塔泰内岛上，他写下了关于欧洲统一的宣言。

Altiero Spinelli, imprisoned by Fascists on island of Ventatene, writes his manifesto for a united Europe.

1942年，英国的贝弗里奇报告提出了福利国家计划。

1942   The Beveridge Report in Britain prescribes welfare state programs.

1944年，弗里德里希·冯·哈耶克出版了《通往奴役之路》。

1944   Friedrich von Hayek publishes The Road to Serfdom.

世界银行是在布雷顿森林会议上成立的。

The World Bank is created at the Bretton Woods conference.

1945年，第二次世界大战以盟军胜利结束。

1945   World War II ends with Allied victory.

工党赢得英国大选。克莱门特·艾德礼出任首相。福利国家制度建立。

Labour Party wins British election. Clement Attlee becomes prime minister. Welfare state launched.

1946 年，法国在让·莫内 (Jean Monnet) 的领导下制定了国家规划。

1946   France establishes national planning under Jean Monnet.

尼赫鲁出版了《印度的发现》。

Nehru publishes The Discovery of India.

凯恩斯在与美国谈判达成英国贷款协议后去世。

Keynes dies after negotiating British loan from the United States.

米尔顿·弗里德曼被任命为芝加哥大学经济系教员。

Milton Friedman is appointed to economics faculty at University of Chicago.

1946-47年欧洲经济危机。

1946-47   Economic crisis in Europe.

1947年，美国启动马歇尔计划，以支持欧洲重建。

1947   U.S. initiates Marshall Plan program to support European reconstruction.

印度在尼赫鲁担任总理的领导下脱离英国获得独立。

India gains its independence from Britain with Nehru as prime minister.

英国将煤炭行业国有化。

Britain nationalizes its coal industry.

1948 年，盟军在西德推行货币改革；苏联封锁柏林，标志着欧洲的分裂。

1948   Allies institute currency reform in western Germany; Soviets blockade Berlin, signifying the division of Europe.

德国财政部长路德维希·艾哈德取消了价格管制，开启了社会市场经济和德国经济奇迹。

German finance minister Ludwig Erhard eliminates price controls, beginning social market economy and German economic miracle.

1949年，毛泽东领导的共产党军队取得胜利，中华人民共和国成立。蒋介石逃往台湾。

1949   Mao Zedong’s communist forces are victorious and the People’s Republic of China is established. Chiang Kai-shek flees to Taiwan.

舒曼计划——由让·莫内制定——创建了煤钢共同体。

Schuman Plan—devised by Jean Monnet—creates Coal and Steel Community.

1950年，朝鲜入侵韩国，朝鲜战争爆发。

1950   North Korea invades South, beginning the Korean War.

1951年，印度的第一个五年计划开始。

1951   India’s first five-year plan begins.

1952 年，阿根廷的伊娃·庇隆 (Eva Perón) 去世，胡安·庇隆 (Juan Perón) 流亡国外。

1952   Argentina’s Eva Perón dies and Juan Perón goes into exile.

1955年，不结盟国家万隆峰会在印度尼西亚举行。

1955   The Bandung summit of nonaligned nations is held in Indonesia.

日本的“体制”为战后快速增长奠定了基础。

The “ System” in Japan lays basis for rapid postwar growth.

1956年，苏联军队残酷镇压了匈牙利的反共革命。

1956   Soviet troops violently repress anti-Communist revolution in Hungary.

苏伊士运河危机导致西方联盟内部出现不和。

Suez crisis creates discord within Western Alliance.

索尼从西屋电气公司获得了晶体管的生产权。

Sony acquires rights to the transistor from Westinghouse.

经济事务研究所成立于伦敦。

Institute of Economic Affairs is established in London.

1957年，德国联邦银行成立，其职责是对抗通货膨胀。

1957   The German Bundesbank is created with obligation to fight inflation.

加纳和马来西亚从英国获得独立；克瓦米·恩克鲁玛——“救世主”——成为加纳总理，后来成为总统。

Ghana and Malaysia gain their independence from Britain; Kwame Nkrumah—“the Redeemer”—becomes Ghana’s prime minister, later president.

《罗马条约》建立了欧洲经济共同体。

The Treaty of Rome establishes the European Economic Community.

英国首相哈罗德·麦克米伦告诉英国人民：“你们从未如此幸福过。”

British prime minister Harold Macmillan tells British people, “You never had it so good.”

1958-60年中国的大跃进。

1958-60   The Great Leap Forward in China.

1960年，弗里德里希·冯·哈耶克出版了《自由宪章》。

1960   Friedrich von Hayek publishes The Constitution of Liberty.

1961年，朴正熙将军在韩国夺取政权，开启了工业化进程。

1961   General Park Chung Hee seizes power in South Korea, launching industrialization.

1962年，米尔顿·弗里德曼出版了《资本主义与自由》。

1962   Milton Friedman publishes Capitalism and Freedom.

美国总统约翰·F·肯尼迪在耶鲁大学发表题为“旧神话，新现实”的演讲。

U.S. president John F. Kennedy delivers “Old Myths, New Realities” speech at Yale.

1964年，日本为了实现“收入翻番”的目标，举办了奥运会。

1964   The Olympics are held in Tokyo, as Japan goes for “income doubling.”

林登·约翰逊总统发起向贫困宣战。

President Lyndon Johnson launches War on Poverty.

美国签署了医疗保险法案。

Medicare bill is signed in United States.

《东京湾决议》授权总统在越南采取行动。

Tonkin Gulf Resolution authorizes presidential action in Vietnam.

毛主席语录—— “毛主席语录”——出版。

Thoughts of Chairman Mao—“the Little Red Book”—is published.

1965年，马来-新加坡联盟成立两年后解体。

1965   Collapse of the Malay-Singapore union two years after its initiation.

李光耀将领导独立的新加坡。

Lee Kuan Yew is to lead independent Singapore.

凯恩斯去世后登上了《时代》杂志的封面。

Keynes posthumously makes the cover of Time magazine.

《公共利益》杂志创办于美国。

The Public Interest journal is established in United States.

1966年，毛泽东在中国发动文化大革命。

1966   Mao unleashes Cultural Revolution in China.

邓小平被单独监禁。

Deng Xiaoping is sent to solitary confinement.

夸梅·恩克鲁玛为加纳的沃尔特大坝举行落成典礼；不久之后，他被推翻。

Kwame Nkrumah inaugurates the Volta Dam in Ghana; shortly after, he is overthrown.

1968年，理查德·M·尼克松当选美国总统。

1968   Richard M. Nixon is elected president of the United States.

苏联坦克粉碎了捷克斯洛伐克的“布拉格之春”和“人道的社会主义”。

Soviet tanks crush Czechoslovakia’s “Prague Spring” and “socialism with a human face.”

德州仪器在新加坡进行了投资。

Texas Instruments invests in Singapore.

1969年反华骚乱扰乱马来西亚，导致新政策出台。

1969   Anti-Chinese riots disrupt Malaysia, leading to new policies.

1970年，阿尔弗雷德·卡恩出版了《监管经济学》。

1970   Alfred Kahn publishes The Economics of Regulation.

萨尔瓦多·阿连德领导的社会主义政府在智利上台，并开始推行大规模国有化计划。

The socialist government of Salvador Allende comes to power in Chile and embarks upon a program of massive nationalizations.

1971 年，尼克松总统推行新经济政策，包括工资和物价管制，并关闭美国黄金窗口，结束了布雷顿森林货币体系。

1971   President Nixon institutes a New Economic Policy, including wage-and-price controls, and closes U.S. gold window, ending Bretton Woods currency system.

1973年，英国加入欧洲经济共同体。

1973   Britain joins European Economic Community.

石油危机冲击全球经济。

Oil shock hits global economy.

韩国启动重化工产业振兴计划。

Heavy and Chemical Industries initiative launched in South Korea.

皮诺切特将军发动血腥政变推翻了智利阿连德政权。随后推行了“砖头”——自由市场改革。

General Pinochet topples Chile’s Allende regime in bloody coup. Subsequently implements “the brick”—free-market reforms.

1974年，印度成为核大国。

1974   India becomes a nuclear power.

英国煤矿工人罢工导致全国停电，迫使英国举行大选。

British coal miners’ strike blacks out the country, forcing election.

弗里德里希·冯·哈耶克与瑞典凯恩斯主义者贡纳尔·默达尔共同获得诺贝尔经济学奖。

Friedrich von Hayek shares the Nobel Prize for Economics with Swedish Keynesian Gunnar Myrdal.

基思·约瑟夫在伦敦创立了政策研究中心。

Keith Joseph establishes Centre for Policy Studies in London.

参议员爱德华·肯尼迪召集法律顾问斯蒂芬·布雷耶就航空业放松管制问题举行听证会。

Senator Edward Kennedy convenes hearings on airline deregulation with staff counsel Stephen Breyer.

1975年，玛格丽特·撒切尔击败爱德华·希思，成为英国保守党领袖。

1975   Margaret Thatcher, defeating Edward Heath, becomes leader of Britain’s Conservative Party.

1975-76年，沙特阿拉伯、科威特和委内瑞拉的石油公司被国有化。

1975-76   Oil companies are nationalized in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and Venezuela.

1976年毛泽东去世。

1976   Mao Zedong dies.

米尔顿·弗里德曼获得诺贝尔经济学奖。

Milton Friedman wins the Nobel Prize for Economics.

1977 年，阿尔弗雷德·卡恩成为民用航空委员会主席，推行了航空业放松管制。

1977   Alfred Kahn becomes chairman of Civil Aeronautics Board, implementing airline deregulation.

1978年，波兰红衣主教卡罗尔·沃伊蒂瓦成为教皇约翰·保罗二世。

1978   Polish cardinal Karol Wojtyla becomes Pope John Paul II.

中共十一大开启了中国的经济改革。邓小平成为最高领导人。

Eleventh Party Congress introduces economic reform in China. Deng Xiaoping emerges as paramount leader.

欧洲货币体系将法郎与德国马克挂钩。

European Monetary System links the franc to the deutsche mark.

1978-79 年英国公共部门雇员在“不满之冬”期间举行罢工。

1978-79   Public-sector employees strike during Britain’s “winter of discontent.”

1979年，玛格丽特·撒切尔成为英国首相。

1979   Margaret Thatcher becomes British prime minister.

朴正熙将军在韩国光州惨案后的政变中被刺杀。

General Park assassinated in coup following the Kwangju massacre in Korea.

第二次石油危机始于伊朗革命。

Second oil crisis begins with Iranian revolution.

吉米·卡特总统在“精神萎靡”演讲中诊断出美国人民存在信心危机。

President Jimmy Carter diagnoses crisis of confidence in American people in “malaise” speech.

卡特任命保罗·沃尔克为美联储主席，以遏制通货膨胀。

Carter appoints Paul Volcker head of Federal Reserve to slay inflation.

1980年，波兰团结工会运动在格但斯克造船厂爆发。

1980   The Polish Solidarity movement begins in the Gdansk shipyards.

罗纳德·里根当选美国总统。

Ronald Reagan is elected president of the United States.

1981年，弗朗索瓦·密特朗成为法兰西第五共和国第一位社会党总统。

1981   François Mitterrand becomes the first Socialist president in the Fifth Republic of France.

美国联邦空中交通管制员罢工。

U.S. federal air traffic controllers strike.

马哈蒂尔·穆罕默德成为马来西亚总理。

Mahathir Mohamad becomes prime minister of Malaysia.

波兰实施戒严令；团结工会被取缔，转入地下活动。

Martial law in Poland; Solidarity, outlawed, goes underground.

1981-82年，实行家庭联产承包责任制，打破了集体化对中国农业的控制。

1981-82   Household responsibility system is introduced, breaking grip of collectivization on Chinese agriculture.

1982年，乔治·斯蒂格勒获得诺贝尔经济学奖。

1982   George Stigler wins the Nobel Prize for Economics.

赫尔穆特·科尔成为德国总理。

Helmut Kohl becomes chancellor of Germany.

福克兰群岛战争爆发于阿根廷占领该岛之后；英国取得胜利。

The Falklands War begins after Argentina seizes islands; Britain victorious.

墨西哥财政崩溃引发债务危机，导致拉丁美洲“失去的十年”。

Mexico’s fiscal collapse triggers debt crisis and “the lost decade” in Latin America.

1982-85年，三位苏联年迈领导人——勃列日涅夫、安德罗波夫和契尔年科——相继去世。

1982-85   Three elderly Soviet leaders—Brezhnev, Andropov, and Chernenko—die in quick succession.

1983年，撒切尔夫人以压倒性优势赢得大选，重返政坛。

1983   Thatcher returned in landslide election victory.

1984年，雅克·德洛尔当选为欧洲共同体委员会主席。

1984   Jacques Delors becomes president of the European Community’s Commission.

英迪拉·甘地遇刺。

Assassination of Indira Gandhi.

邓小平发表了《建设中国特色社会主义》

Deng Xiaoping publishes Building of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics.

英国电信私有化进程启动。

Privatization of British Telecom begins.

新西兰推出激进改革方案以应对货币危机。

New Zealand launches radical reform program in response to currency crisis.

1985 年玻利维亚第 21060 号法令标志着休克疗法的开始。

1985   Decree 21060 in Bolivia signals the start of shock therapy.

米哈伊尔·戈尔巴乔夫上台，决心推行改革。

Mikhail Gorbachev comes to power intent on promoting reform.

英国煤矿工人罢工结束，撒切尔夫人取得胜利。

British coal strike ends with Thatcher victory.

1986年，国际金融公司说服美国国际投资者为第一支新兴市场基金筹集了5000万美元。

1986   The International Finance Corporation persuades U.S. international investors to come up with $50 million for the first emerging-market fund.

1987 年，欧盟委员会批准了《单一欧洲法案》，旨在建立单一市场。

1987   The Single European Act, to create single market, approved by EC.

小说家马里奥·巴尔加斯·略萨成为秘鲁改革运动的领袖。

Novelist Mario Vargas Llosa becomes the leader of reform movement in Peru.

1988年，东京证券交易所的市值与纽约证券交易所的市值持平。

1988   The capitalization of the Tokyo Stock Exchange equals that of New York’s.

1989 年波兰团结工会、天主教会和共产党举行圆桌会议。

1989   Roundtable talks in Poland between Solidarity, the Catholic Church, and the Communists.

天安门广场中国学生抗议活动遭到镇压。

Chinese student protest suppressed in Tiananmen Square.

柏林墙倒塌，标志着欧洲分裂的结束。

The Berlin Wall comes down, marking end of Europe’s division.

卡洛斯·梅内姆赢得阿根廷总统选举。

Carlos Menem wins the presidency of Argentina.

波兰、捷克斯洛伐克、匈牙利、罗马尼亚和保加利亚的共产主义政权垮台。

Communist governments fall in Poland, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Romania, and Bulgaria.

1990年，东西德货币统一。两个德国统一。

1990   West and East German currencies are unified. The two Germanys unify.

巴尔采罗维奇的休克疗法在波兰生效。

Balcerowicz’s shock therapy goes into effect in Poland.

团结工会领导人莱赫·瓦文萨当选波兰总统。

Solidarity leader Lech Walesa is elected president of Poland.

智利举行大选；民主政府保留自由市场改革。伊拉克入侵科威特。

Elections in Chile; democratic government retains free-market reforms. Iraq invades Kuwait.

1991年，苏联解体，15个苏联加盟共和国成为独立国家。

1991   The Soviet Union disintegrates and the fifteen Soviet Republics become independent nations.

鲍里斯·叶利钦成为独立后的俄罗斯联邦总统。

Boris Yeltsin becomes president of independent Russian Federation.

PV Narasimha Rao 成为印度总理，并启动经济改革。

P. V. Narasimha Rao becomes India’s prime minister and initiates economic reforms.

《马斯特里赫特条约》签署，该条约规定了单一欧洲货币。

The Maastricht treaty, providing for single European currency, is signed.

阿尔韦托·藤森在与马里奥·巴尔加斯·略萨的决选中赢得秘鲁总统选举。

Alberto Fujimori wins the Peruvian presidential election in a runoff against Mario Vargas Llosa.

1992年，邓小平率领南迅前往中国南方，保护经济改革。

1992   Deng Xiaoping takes his nanxun to southern China to protect economic reforms.

日本经济泡沫破裂，陷入深度衰退。

Japan enters a deep slump as “bubble economy” bursts.

俄罗斯大规模私有化计划启动。

Russia’s massive privatization program starts.

加里·贝克尔荣获诺贝尔经济学奖。

Gary Becker wins the Nobel Prize in Economics.

美国财政赤字达到2900亿美元。

U.S. deficit reaches $290 billion.

美国、加拿大和墨西哥签署了《北美自由贸易协定》。

North American Free Trade Agreement signed among United States, Canada, and Mexico.

1993年，新民主党人比尔·克林顿当选美国总统。

1993   New Democrat Bill Clinton becomes U.S. president.

韩国总统金泳三发起大规模反腐运动。

Korean president Kim Young-Sam launches major anticorruption campaign.

阿根廷石油公司YPF通过IPO出售了价值30亿美元的股票。

Argentina’s oil company, YPF, sells $3 billion of stock in IPO.

1994年，费尔南多·恩里克·卡多佐引入雷亚尔以稳定巴西经济。

1994   Fernando Henrique Cardoso introduces the real to stabilize Brazilian economy.

共和党宣布其与美国人民的契约，并赢得了美国国会两院的控制权。

The Republican Party proclaims its Contract with America and wins both houses of the U.S. Congress.

世界贸易组织成立。

World Trade Organization is established.

1995年，前共产党人亚历山大·克瓦希涅夫斯基击败莱赫·瓦文萨当选波兰总统，但他承诺不会改变经济改革。

1995   Former Communist Alexsander Kwasniewski defeats Lech Walesa for the Polish presidency but promises not to alter economic reforms.

共和党籍众议院议长纽特·金里奇被《时代》杂志评选为年度人物。

Newt Gingrich, Republican Speaker of the House, is chosen as Time magazine’s Man of the Year.

墨西哥货币贬值后，拉丁美洲股市受到“龙舌兰酒效应”冲击。

“Tequila effect” hits Latin American stock markets after Mexican devaluation.

1995-96年美国联邦政府停摆是由于预算僵局造成的。

1995-96   U.S. federal government shutdown results from budget impasse.

1996年，比尔·克林顿宣布大政府的终结。

1996   Bill Clinton proclaims the end of big government.

俄罗斯股市是全球表现最佳的新兴市场。

Russian stock market is world’s best-performing emerging market.

李登辉是台湾本地人，是台湾首位民选总统。

A native Taiwanese, Lee Teng-hui, is the first democratically elected president of Taiwan.

韩国前总统卢泰愚和全斗焕因贪污罪被判有罪。

Former Korean presidents Roh Tae-Woo and Chun Doo Hwan are convicted of corruption.

1997年邓小平去世。

1997   Deng Xiaoping dies.

香港按照“一国两制”回归中国。

Hong Kong returns to China on basis of “one country, two systems.”

新工党成员托尼·布莱尔以撒切尔式的经济政策为纲领，并融入人道主义精神，成为英国首相。

New Labourite Tony Blair becomes Britain’s prime minister on a platform of Thatcherite economics leavened with compassion.

利昂内尔·若斯潘当选法国总理，并提出了让人想起20世纪80年代初社会党政策的计划。

Lionel Jospin wins prime ministership of France and presents plans that recall the Socialist policies of the early 1980s.

货币危机冲击东南亚“经济奇迹”。

Currency crisis hits Southeast Asian “miracle” economies.

中国党的十五大批准解散庞大的国有部门，并采纳了“邓小平理论”。

Fifteenth Party Congress in China endorses dismantling of massive state-owned sector and adopts “Deng Xiaoping Theory.”

美国财政赤字降至220亿美元。

U.S. deficit drops to $22 billion.

笔记

访谈

 

INTERVIEWS

 

许多人慷慨地接受了采访，这对本书的写作至关重要。我们衷心感谢他们的友善和体谅。本书中的任何解读和判断均与他们无关。

MANY PEOPLE generously made themselves available for interviews, which were essential to the writing of this book. We would like to express our great appreciation to all of them for their graciousness and consideration. None of them is responsible for the interpretations and judgments in this book.

致谢

 

ACKNOWLEDGMENTS

 

在研究和写作过程中，本书的研究范围远超我们最初的预期。我们发现自己不仅要探讨二十一世纪的历史，还要从一个特定的视角来审视二十世纪后半叶的历史。在此过程中，我们受益匪浅，在此谨向许多人致谢。

In the course of its research and writing, this book turned into a much larger inquiry than we had initially anticipated. We found ourselves writing about the twenty-first century and, from a particular perspective, about the history of the last half of the twentieth century. In so doing, we acquired debts to many people, which we wish to acknowledge.

有三位人士对本书的创作产生了特殊影响，我们对此深表感激。

Three people had special impact on this book. And to them we are especially grateful.

CERA 特别项目主管苏·莉娜·汤普森 (Sue Lena Thompson) 将本书视为一个非常特殊的项目并给予了指导。本书的成功很大程度上得益于她对项目各个环节的智慧、奉献、理解和信念。在我们之前，她就已经对本书的最终形态有了清晰的构想，并且她对思想与人之间的互动有着独到的见解。

Sue Lena Thompson, who is director of special projects at CERA, guided this as a very special project. This book benefited enormously from the intelligence, dedication, grasp, and conviction that she brought to bear on every dimension of this project. She had a vision of what this book could be before we did, and she contributed a particular insight into the interaction of ideas and people.

悉达多·米特是一位才华横溢的青年学者。他暂时搁置了自己关于新非洲的研究，将他的才华和分析能力运用到我们的工作中。他严谨的学术态度弥足珍贵，他对政治经济相互作用和变革动力的独特洞察力也同样重要。苏·莱娜和悉达多在应对挑战的同时，也展现出了幽默感、热情和必要的灵活性，他们始终保持着非凡的奉献精神。

Siddhartha Mitter is a young scholar of uncommon ability. He temporarily put aside his own work on the new Africa to apply his talent and analytic capabilities to our task. His intellectual rigor was invaluable, as was his unique feel for the interplay of politics and economics and the dynamics of change. Both Sue Lena and Siddhartha balanced their focus on the challenge with humor, spirit, and much-needed flexibility, and they never wavered in their extraordinary commitment.

我们在西蒙与舒斯特出版社的编辑弗雷德里克·希尔斯看到了这本书的潜力，并鼓励我们拓展内容。他构思了主题，并与我们一起参与思考和设计。他要求很高，有时甚至近乎苛刻；但他同时也非常支持我们，始终与我们并肩作战，付出了远超预期的努力。他的投入是绝对的。任何作者都为能与他合作而感到幸运。

Our editor at Simon & Schuster, Frederic Hills, saw the possibilities and challenged us to stretch the book. He conceptualized the themes and joined us in the thinking and design. He was always demanding, usually relentlessly so; he was also supportive, stood by us throughout, and went several extra miles, more miles perhaps than he even expected. His commitment was absolute. He is an editor that any author is lucky to have.

我们还要深深感谢团队中其他不可或缺的成员：布里奇特·尼利（Bridgett Neely）负责组织和协调这项分散的项目。她对研究做出了重要贡献，并始终不渝地秉持着团队精神。梅根·奥茨（Meghan Oates）是一位杰出的研究员，她对我们讲述这个故事至关重要。她以不懈的毅力和创造力应对了看似不可能完成的任务。彼得·斯皮格勒（Peter Spiegler）带来了……乔安娜·克莱因思维敏锐，学术严谨，对历史和经济学有着精辟的理解。她同时也是一位勇于探索的研究者和富有洞察力的分析师。苏珊·纳尔多内在整个项目中给予我们耐心和体贴的支持，协调访谈和其他项目环节，同时还要应对其他诸多需求。在制作方面，特蕾莎·张在重重压力下展现了高超的技能，迈克·凯利和吉格·莫伊诺也慷慨地提供了帮助。在巴黎，达格玛·沃尔夫的组织工作细致周到，阿内特·德米勒也为访谈过程提供了有力的支持。

We are also deeply grateful to the others who were integral to the team: Bridgett Neely kept this far-flung project organized and coordinated the effort. She also made an important contribution to the research and resolutely carried the spirit. Meghan Oates was a superb researcher, integral to our ability to tell this story. She responded to the most impossible assignments with unfailing perseverance and creativity. Peter Spiegler brought an incisive mind and a scholarly thoroughness and contributed a deft understanding of history and economics. Johanna Klein was also an intrepid researcher and insightful analyst. Susan Nardone supported us throughout this venture with patience and consideration, coordinating interviews and other aspects of this project balanced against the barrage of other demands. In production, Teresa Chang helped us with great skill in the face of many pressures, and Mike Kelly and Gig Moineau also kindly assisted us. In Paris, Dagmar Wulf was gracious and thoughtful in her organizational work, and Arnette de Mille also capably supported the interviewing process.

图片部分最初由 1200 张照片组成，由 Sue Lena Thompson 和 Bridgett Neely 在 Siddhartha Mitter 的帮助下，经过不懈努力创建而成。

The picture section, which started with 1,200 photos, was created—with much determination in the making—by Sue Lena Thompson and Bridgett Neely with the help of Siddhartha Mitter.

我们衷心感谢所有接受采访的人，感谢他们抽出时间分享他们的想法和经验。他们的名单已列在采访部分。但我们尤其要感谢撒切尔夫人，并特别感谢韦克汉姆勋爵。

We certainly are most appreciative to those we interviewed, who took the time to share their thinking and experience. They are listed in the interview section. But we wish to express our special gratitude to Baroness Thatcher. And we particularly want to thank Lord Wakeham.

我们要向我们的同事兼合作伙伴詹姆斯·罗森菲尔德表达我们的感激之情，他看到了这个故事，鼓励我们接受它，帮助创造了使之成为可能的空间，并将他自己的智力优势融入到结构和实质中。

We want to convey our gratitude to our colleague and partner James Rosenfield, who saw the story, encouraged us to take it on, helped create the space to make it possible, and brought his own intellectual strengths to the structure and substance.

我们尤其要感谢两位导师，在他们的职业生涯中，国家与市场问题始终占据着核心地位。在探讨这些问题时，我们无法忽视雷蒙德·弗农教授在过去半个世纪里对这些议题产生的深远影响。爱德华·乔丹在关键时期也身处这些问题的核心。在本书的写作过程中，他们始终是我们重要的顾问。

We owe a special thank-you to two mentors, in whose professional lives issues of state and marketplace have been central. It is impossible to write about these issues without acknowledging the profound intellectual impact that Professor Raymond Vernon has had on them over the half century. Edward Jordan was at the center of these issues at a critical time. Both were always available to us as advisers as we negotiated our way through this book.

我们非常感谢 ICM 的 Amanda Urban 和 Jim Wiatt 的付出、鼓励和支持。

We are most grateful to Amanda Urban and Jim Wiatt at ICM for their commitment, encouragement, and support.

安吉拉·斯滕特多次审阅这份手稿的修改稿，并在每个阶段都给予我们指导。她精辟的评论和对二十世纪历史的深刻理解使我们受益匪浅。

Angela Stent read this manuscript through many incarnations and advised us at every stage. We benefited greatly from her incisive comments and her command of twentieth-century history.

我们衷心感谢以下人士对稿件提出的宝贵意见：Christopher Beauman、John Browne、Valéry Giscard d'Estaing、Ian Hargreaves、Rudolph Penner、Nicholas X. Rizopoulos、Augusta Stanislaw 和 Steven R. Weisman 为我们提供了深入且富有洞见的审阅，我们从中受益匪浅。他们也慷慨地贡献了宝贵的时间。我们向他们致谢。

We greatly benefited from the criticism, advice, help, and support of our colleagues at Cambridge Energy Research Associates. We are grateful to colleagues who contributed to this project: Steve Aldrich, Simon Blakey, I. C. Bupp, James Clad, William Durbin, Dennis Eklof, Thane Gustafson, Ann-Louise Hittle, Peter Hughes, Bruce Humphrey, Kevin Lindemer, Huaibin Lu, Daniel Lucking, Elizabeth McCrary, Philippe Michelon, James Placke, Tom Robinson, Sondra Scott, Gary Simon, and Julian West. Other colleagues who helped us at CERA include: Alice Barsoomian, Jennifer Battersby, Barbara Blodgett, Peter Bogin, Sara Burr, Diana Frame, William Hamilton, John Hoffmann, Kelly Knight, Susan Krouscup, Susan Leland, Micheline Manoncourt, Susan Ruth, Helen Sisley, and Tanya Ustyantseva.

过去十年，国家和市场的作用一直是 CERA 的核心主题，因此我们真的要感谢全体员工，他们在学术上和工作上都支持了我们。

The role of state and marketplace has been a central theme of CERA over the last decade, and thus we really owe our thank-you to the entire staff, who supported us both intellectually and in their work.

哈佛大学肯尼迪政府学院向商业与政府中心主任罗杰·波特和院长约瑟夫·奈致以深切的谢意。

At the Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University, our deep appreciation to Roger Porter, director of the Center for Business and Government, and Joseph Nye, dean.

全球决策集团在此向 Alberto Cribiore、Gordon McMahon 和 David Nixon 以及 Peter Derow 致以诚挚的谢意，他们的审阅对我们帮助极大。我们还要感谢 David Leuschen、Eric Dobkin、Richard Hayden、Peter Wheeler、Varkki Chacko 及其同事们持续不断的交流。此外，我们还要感谢 Leslie Dach、Michael Connelly 及其同事们。

At Global Decision Group, we want to express our appreciation to Alberto Cribiore, Gordon McMahon, and David Nixon, and to Peter Derow, whose reading was most helpful. We want to thank David Leuschen, Eric Dobkin, Richard Hayden, Peter Wheeler, Varkki Chacko, and their colleagues for their continuing dialogue. And we thank Leslie Dach, Michael Connelly, and their colleagues.

西蒙与舒斯特出版社的各位工作人员对作者们给予了应有的尊重和关怀。编辑伯顿·贝斯是一位出色且体贴周到的人，他的细致和敬业精神发挥了至关重要的作用。希拉里·布莱克也全身心投入到这个项目中，并做出了关键贡献。我们非常感谢她的付出。维罗妮卡·温德霍尔茨（Veronica Windholz）是一位杰出且善解人意的文字编辑，她性格温和。我们尤其感谢莱斯利·艾伦（Leslie Ellen），她负责统筹整个项目，并竭尽全力使看似不可能的任务成为可能。她不仅拥有高标准的工作要求，更具备化不可能为可能的能力。琳恩·安德森（Lynn Anderson）是我们眼光敏锐、一丝不苟的校对员。我们也非常感谢制作主管约翰·瓦勒（John Wahler），他克服重重困难确保了项目按时完成；我们还要特别感谢维多利亚·迈耶（Victoria Meyer）、约翰·穆尼（John Mooney）、凯特·拉金（Kate Larkin）和凯伦·韦茨曼（Karen Weitzman）。卡罗琳·雷迪（Carolyn Reidy）、大卫·罗森塔尔（David Rosenthal）和安妮克·拉法格（Annik LaFarge）的支持至关重要，我们对此深表感谢。

The people at Simon & Schuster have treated the authors as well as any authors deserve. Burton Béais, a wonderful and considerate editor, brought a thoughtfulness and commitment that made a real difference. Hilary Black was committed to the project and played a key role. We greatly valued her gracious temperament. Veronica Windholz was a superb and understanding copy editor. We are especially grateful to Leslie Ellen, who oversaw the effort and went out of her way to make the daunting possible. Her high standards were matched by her ability to do the impossible. Lynn Anderson was our eagle-eyed and vigilant proofreader. We are also very appreciative to John Wahler, the head of production, who made sure that the schedule was met against all odds; and we are most grateful to Victoria Meyer, John Mooney, Kate Larkin, and Karen Weitzman. The support of Carolyn Reidy, David Rosenthal, and Annik LaFarge was essential and is much appreciated.

伦敦西蒙与舒斯特出版社要向尼克·韦伯（Nick Webb）表达我们的谢意，他从一开始就致力于这本书的创作，还要向凯瑟琳·斯科菲尔德（Catherine Schofield）表达我们的谢意。

At Simon & Schuster in London we want to express our appreciation to Nick Webb, who was committed to the book from early on, and also to Catherine Schofield.

图片部分的创建本身就是一项长达一年的任务，我们感谢以下人员和档案馆：Archive Photos，Larry Schwartz；Corbis-Bettmann，Talya Schaeffer；Hulton-Getty，Henry Wilks；Tony Stone Images，Kathy Carcia；以及 SYGMA，Anne Manning。

The creation of the photo section was in itself a year-long task, and our thanks to the following people and archives: Archive Photos, Larry Schwartz; Corbis-Bettmann, Talya Schaeffer; Hulton-Getty, Henry Wilks; Tony Stone Images, Kathy Carcia; and SYGMA, Anne Manning.

最后，我们要感谢我们的家人——安吉拉·斯滕特、丽贝卡和亚历山大·耶金；以及奥古斯塔、路易斯、卡特里娜和亨利·斯坦尼斯瓦夫。他们的理解和宽容经受了反复的考验，他们的支持、鼓励和参与至关重要。我们感激不尽。

We conclude by thanking our families—Angela Stent, and Rebecca and Alexander Yergin; and Augusta, Louis, Katrina, and Henry Stanislaw. Their understanding and forbearance were tested repeatedly and their support, encouragement, and engagement were more than essential. We surely cannot thank them enough.

关于作者

 

ABOUT THE AUTHORS

 

丹尼尔·耶金是一位享誉国际的作家，著有畅销全球的《奖赏：石油、金钱与权力的史诗之旅》（The Prize: The Epic Questfor Oil, Money, and Power），该书荣获普利策奖和埃克尔斯奖，并被改编成一部八集的PBS系列纪录片。他也是冷战经典著作《破碎的和平》（Shattered Peace ）的作者，并与他人合著了畅销书《能源未来》（Energy Future）和《2010年的俄罗斯及其对世界的影响》（Russia 2010 and What It Means for the World）。耶金是剑桥能源研究协会（Cambridge Energy Research Associates）的总裁，该公司是能源行业领先的分析公司；同时，他也是全球决策集团（Global Decision Group）的副主席，该集团为全球主要市场提供经济和风险分析。他是哈佛大学肯尼迪学院商业与政府中心的研究员。他拥有耶鲁大学的文学学士学位和剑桥大学的博士学位，在剑桥大学期间曾是马歇尔学者。他目前居住在马萨诸塞州剑桥市和华盛顿特区。

A writer of international renown, Daniel Yergin is the author of The Prize: The Epic Questfor Oil, Money, and Power, the global best-seller and winner of the Pulitzer Prize and the Eccles Prize that was made into an eight-part PBS series. He is also the author of Shattered Peace, the classic account of the Cold War, and coauthor of the best-seller Energy Future and Russia 2010 and What It Means for the World. Yergin is president of Cambridge Energy Research Associates, a leading analytic firm in the energy industries, and vice-chairman of Global Decision Group, which provides economic and risk analysis on major global markets. He is a Fellow of the Center for Business and Government at Harvard’s Kennedy School. He received a B.A. from Yale University and a Ph.D. from Cambridge University, where he was a Marshall Scholar. He lives in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and in Washington, D.C.

约瑟夫·斯坦尼斯劳博士是国际市场和政治领域的权威顾问，现任剑桥能源研究协会董事总经理、全球研究主管兼巴黎欧洲办事处主任。斯坦尼斯劳博士经常奔走于世界各地，为企业和国家提供战略咨询，帮助他们应对瞬息万变的市场中的风险和机遇。他拥有哈佛大学学士学位和爱丁堡大学博士学位，曾任剑桥大学教授。他曾任经合组织国际能源署（位于巴黎）高级经济学家，目前担任全球决策集团和巴黎美国大学的董事会成员。他现居法国巴黎。

A leading adviser on international markets and politics, Joseph Stanislaw is managing director of Cambridge Energy Research Associates, head of global research, and director of its European office in Paris. Dr. Stanislaw travels extensively worldwide, advising companies and countries on strategies to deal with the risks and opportunities in the newly evolving marketplace. He holds a B.A. from Harvard University and a Ph.D. from Edinburgh University and was formerly a professor at Cambridge University. He was senior economist at the OECD International Energy Agency in Paris and currently serves on the board of the Global Decision Group and of the American University in Paris. He lives in Paris, France.
